content:
ry 5, 2016
An amazing game that manages to be all about zombies, without being a trite hoard mode survival shooter.Dying light is a unique game for how it manages to walk a fine line of an action, horror, and exploration.  You start out simply enough, learning how to run, jump, and parkour your way around the city while bashing zombies with generic weapons like rusty pipes.  Lending itself to the active running and combat gameplay are the talent trees.  Every time you use a weapon you gain experience toward the power skill tree, and climbing buildings increases your agility skill. This all leads to new abilities that change how you play the game.  Using a skill based leveling system also lends itself to the game's open world design.  In Dying Light you're encouraged to explore by two things, leveling up and random loot.  Similar to games like Diablo and Borderlands, Dying Light utilizes a classic colored random loot system for all the weapons you find in the world.  These weapons however are directly tied to a third skill tree, Survival.  Your Survival skill is what governs the quality of loot you find in the world, and survival points are only acquired by completing quests, helping survivors, or running for airdrops.  This three point system ensures that you're encouraged to explore and complete quests to level up, to get better loot, to kill stronger zombies, to do harder quests, to level up, to get better loot- you get the idea.  Additionally finding powerful weapons is kept in check with item durability, and all weapons need repair but will eventually break completely.   Thus even when you utilizes the games basic crafting system to create an amazing arm, you're encouraged to stay on the lookout for new and equally powerful weapons.  Topping all of this off is a day night cycle that gives the game a risk reward element.  During the day the world is filled with mostly unthreatening shambling zombies, but at night the map is populated with fast running and powerful super zombies called volatiles.  Normally you want to avoid going out at night, but when the real horrors come out the agility and power experience you gain are doubled, giving a sometimes much needed boost to skill leveling.  What's more there are many side quests that require you to run at night and dive head first into dangerous zombie dens, further encouraging you to go out after dark.  All and all Dying light is an amazing although imperfect game that manages to be all about zombies, without being a trite hoard mode survival shooter.  If you like RPGs, exploring, looting, and simple crafting, then Dying Light is for you.

												Is the game perfect? No, but no game is.Is it going to be fun for everyone? Not if they have a weak computer or just don't enjoy the genre.Have I played any games that do open world zombie survival better? Absolutly not, this is by far the best game of its type.8.5/10 Half a point off for minor technical issues (typical NV Gameworks nonsense, etc)Half a point off for nonsense goofball weapons that don't really fit in with the rest of the game (duct tape a knife to another knife and then duct tape that to a molotov coctail and somehow you have a sword with improved durability, damage, and lights enemies on fire... wtf?) and other immersion quirks.Half a point off for some pretty strictly pay-to-win DLCs (Weapons that beat anything you can get otherwise in the game, and are avaliable from the very start if you buy the DLCs).

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
30
												Where do I start. First off, this is one of the best games I have ever played. It's like Dead Island, except better in every possible way. Graphics are great, facial animations are great, and just overall a great atmostphere. You really feel as if you are actually in the game, it pulls you in and doesn't let go.        The parkour aspect is top notch. It feels genuine, and not like some arcadey junk. Running across rooftops, climbing fences, and running away from volatiles at night really gets your blood going.         Combat system is great. Most of the weapons you will use are melee weapons (one handed and two handed), but there are also guns (pistols, assault rifles, shotguns, smgs), a bow with different arrow types and a crossbow thrown into the mix once you start the following. There are a ton of collectible blueprints scattered around the map, and some you can get from completing missions, that you can use to enhance your melee weapon with different effects like Toxic, Electric, Fire, and Impact. More advanced blueprints let you put two effects on one weapon. It is so damn staisfying chopping off heads with a machete and bashing in zombie skulls with a sledgehammer.          The story is alright, not going to dive into any spoilers, but it does its job in keeping everything flowing smoothly. I have completed the main story twice now, and all of the side quests as well.          You get two different maps in the base game, Slums and Old Town, that I think are very detailed and do a good job of rewarding exploration. Each one has a very different feel to it, and that helps add to the overall atmostphere of the game.          This is one of the few games where I have found/completed most of the easter eggs, and collected most if not all of the developer blueprints. No other game has made me want to come back and throughly collect and explore as much as Dying Light. I love going around and exploring every little nook and cranny, just to make sure there's nothing that I missed. The biggest thing I have accomplished is grinding for about 12 hours or so, getting around 9k disater relief packages to reach max legend level at 250. I don't believe any other game will pull me back in as much as this one.           To sum it up, Dying Light is one of the best games I have and I think I will ever play. Everything from the graphics, the animations, the combat, the parkour and the story, feels very very solid and well done. And as much fun as it is to play it alone, playing with your friends is an absolute blast. Techland nailed this one. 10/10

												I have been waiting so long for a new hit zombie game since L4D2! But for me this is game of the year or even game of the generation, in general not even just in the zombie genre. The graphics (played on max) is unbelievable, the shadows, the sun and glare, reflections. My favorite thing is the the Night-Day cycle, very realistic as the sun goes down and ♥♥♥♥ gets scary! I love having to scavenge for well pretty much everything, all the weapon modifications and upgrades you can do.. The story is really good too, i love the characters and really felt the connection with them. Im almost done the story but i will for sure still be playing for hours just choppin zombies legs off, drop kicking them off building etc.. never gets boring. The only negative thing i have to say is sometimes the side missions are abit boring, and that is truly just my opinion, i feel a bit of repetition here.. where as i always just need to get scavenge for supplies, although you'll sometimes learn abit more about the characters and their story. Overall I give it 10/10 perfect game, a MUST TRY next gen game.

content:
er 28, 2015
												ENGLISH:This game is a selective one. If you liked Dead Island you will probably liked this one too. Because it gives you;-Parkour system which also means more freedom while rushing around.-Basic level customization of weapons that you will find it easy to understand and apply.-Day and Night cycle that gives you the true meaning of zombie rush.Graphics are ok. Because when you are on the high settings there isn't really anything to bother you. Since gameplay is so smooth that sometimes you ignore the graphics. Also after updates game's stability boosted , I only countered 1 or 2 crash to desktop with my over 70 hours. I gotta say that I enjoyed both Dead Island and Dying Light. If I had to write bad side of the game that would be ;-Totally cliche characters that we don't even embrace.-Short storyline-Ending feels empty.-Some minor glitches/bugs while freerunning on the narrow passes.Hard mode and "dead is dead" simply makes the game more fun but you lack of vision makes you little bit upset. So I advice you to complete the game on "normal" then go for a real fun at "hard" with "dead is dead" mentality.There is a huge upcoming DLC and I believe it will add much more fun to game.TÜRKÇE:Oyun olması gerektiği şekilde çıksaydı adını Dead Island 2 olarak görebilirdik. Ancak yapımcı anlaşmazlıkları vs. derken oyun yapımcısı olan Polonyalı şirket WB ile anlaşıp kendi oyununu çıkartacağını açıklamıştı. İyi yapmışlar diyebilirim.Oyuna gelirsek Dead Island oyunundan hoşlandıysanız bu oyun hoşunuza gidecektir diye düşünüyorum. Çünkü ;-Çatılara tırmanma vb. gibi bir çok özgürlük sağlıyor. Şehirde istediğiniz gibi dolaşabiliyorsunuz.-Silah yapımı karmaşık değil gayet sade ve iş görür biçimde. Çok komplike şeyler yapmayı hayal etmeyin yani-Gece ve gündüz değişimi oyuna çok farklı bir hava katıyor. Geceleri özellikle zor seviyede inanılmaz çılgın atıyorsunuz.Oyunda çok fazla hata almadım. 70 küsür saatlik süremde 1 veya 2 kere masaüstüne attı yani ben kendi sistemimde test ettiğim kadarı ile gayet akıcı , stabil bir oyun oynadım darısı alanların başına.Kötü taraflarına geleceksek ;-Karakterleri hiçbir şekilde benimseyemedim , çünkü çok klişeler.-Hikaye çok kısa , yan görevleri yapmazsanız bitirmeniz 9 saati bulmuyor. Ancak yan görevlerle 30-40 saat garanti.-Oyun sonu hakkında spoiler vermek istemiyorum ancak hiçbirşey hissetmediğim gerçeğini atlayamam.-Çatılarda , dar geçişlerden geçerken tutunamama vb tarzı sıkıntılar yaşayabiliyorsunuz bu canınızı hayli sıkıyor.Oyunu öncelikle "normal" zorlukta oynamanızı daha sonra "hard" zorlukta oynamanızı öneririm. Çünkü direk "hard" zorlukta başlamak ölüm fermanı gibi birşey çünkü oyunda bazı bilinmesi gereken detaylar var. Zombiler genelde diğer oyunlarla aynı tipte olsada bazı zayıflıkları ve güçtü tarafları var bunların bilinmesi özellikle oyun geceyken çok işinize yarayabilir.Bunun dışında zor modda tek ölüm hakkınız varmış gibi oynarsanız oyunun gerçek hissiyatını alıyorsunuz "gıdım gıdım" yürümek deyimi yerini buluyor özellikle zombilerin nefesini ensenizde hissettiğiniz zaman. İşin komik tarafına gelecek olursak , sabah "laylaylom/gel lan buraya" diyerek kestiğiniz zombiler akşam bir "Kara Murat" edasıyla çatılardan bacalardan zıplayıp hayatı size zehir ediyorlar. Zaten alırda geceye girerseniz dediğim bu lafa gülmemeniz işten bile değil.İyi eğlenceler.

												Great game.  I bought it on release date of the following,  these hours have been put in since then.  An awesome game.  Great to play with current friends or to make new friends.  Decent story and very well optimized currently.  Running @ 60 fps with vsync at 4k resolution on 2 980 ti'sThe main game has a decent story as I said, (better than I expected).  The multiplayer aspect keeps the game fresh for you, in my opinion.  It may also make you a bit braver about going out at night :).  The visuals are stunning.  Especially at Ultra.  I haven't found too many glitches, a few but none that are game breaking.  I have completed the game once and I am currently working on the following and the game has only crashed on me once the entire time.  I don't have the best internet unfortunately, only 20mbps and I have had very few connection issues on the multiplayer side.  Loot system is cool as well as the rpg aspects of the game.  I have had a blast with this game.  It makes you feel bad ♥♥♥ when you start getting good weapons and high level.  Once I got a cross bow I felt like Darrel Dixon from Walking Dead :)  You can too! Hit that buy button!If anyone starting out wants someone to play the game with just Pm me and friend me.

content:
y 6
												Dying Light: The Following - EE Is an amazing game which incorporates fast parkour-like movement and a brutal & bloody combat system. The game itself has an amazing story, fantastic graphics, and fun mechanics. As is probbably already obvious, this is a game which takes place in a "zombie universe" where the fictional city of "Harran" has been overrun and quarantined from the rest of the world. You are Kyle Crane, a GRE (Global Relief Effort) operative and it is up to you to do something about it. Pros:-Amazing Graphics-Fun movement & combat system-Interesting & immersive story-Decent amount of stuff to do ingame (sidequests challenges etc)-Co-op is pretty cool if you're into that kind of thing (I still finished most of it solo)-The Following DLC adds more mechanics and an additional map and campaign, which are amazing!-High FPS 90% of the game (50~60) with a medium specced setup. (And medium settings)Cons:- Some of the challenges really are not any fun at all, however if you're a completionist you'll find yourself performing many stressfull challenges.-Only The Following is a worthy DLC, the rest just seems worse quality. Especially the (imo) lacking in fun, Bozak Horde DLCPS: If you pick up or just have picked up Dying Light, dont forget to google "Dying Light Weapon Dockets" which is a nice way to get a few extra's ingame (while still possible, most codes have expired) And if you have an android or apple phone don't forget the companion app which apparently can in the end help you scavenge for King upgrades (legendary mods) if you level up your runners in the app.Good night, and good luck survivors!

content:
er 12, 2016
												Dying Light is an absolute masterpiece when it comes to zombie games. As it is indeed THE zombie game. It combines one of the best free-running mechanics I've ever seen with an incredibly detailed map and rather well built. Which adds more to the experience.At the start you begin with nothing and feel naked, but as you progress this fear dissipitates and another sets in, which is the volatiles and the hunters.The way the game keeps you on your toes is incredible and the story even if a bit cliche keeps it all together. Having experienced both the dying light and the following and still getting a kick out of the game with new game(+) mode where you can keep all your stuff and perks. Other than that the game is extremely well optimized and even amongst the chaos, the blood, the massacre and the running you'll find yourself stopping on top of a building to just gaze on the map. Verdict : Dying Light is hands down THE zombie AND the best parkour game I have ever played and I recommend it to anyone who wants something like the undead genre to be refreshed through a solid campaign, a good multiplayer which offers competition as well as rewards and an overall excellent experience.Absolutely a 10/10!!!

 A Trully Fantastic Experience!   Pros • Parkour Acrobatics• Awesome Weapons• Great Free roam• Co-op • Good level(s) of challenging• Plenty of Missions and side quests• Decent Graphic Options (but options like Anti-Aliasing On/Off sucks)• MODs Support• Easter Eggs• THOSE DAMN VOLATILES!! :P Cons • No Easy Difficulty (However coming from the Dead island games this is not surprising) • Not everything is explained or shown, you will need to learn or research a few things yourself (e.g. house with red smoke or quarantine zones)• Survivor Points death penalty (although i understand why they did this, it still feels like a kick in the nuts)• Recycled Combat system (and yes i say the same for games such as Assassin's Creed)• Predictable story• Rank Progression is a little slow (not recommended for people without patience)• THOSE DAMN VOLATILES!!! :POverall I very much enjoyed this game.Techland has made a very enjoyable game. 9/10

content:
ry 9, 2015
A must have for all zombie/survival fans out there.Already played Dead Island ? Liked it ? Well Dead island was like the pre-alpha of this game.You can move all around Parkour-Style and drop-kick zombies 'till they get stuck into walls !Craft and loot mechanics are very similar to Dead Island. Your weapons have limited lifetime, you can't repair them more than a defined number of times but it's not as limiting as it sounds. You can craft and find a lot of weapons so you'll find yourself selling/dismantling more weapon in an hour than you'll break in a day.Co-op is just what this game was made for : watch your friends die slowly when they fail a jump in a mass of zombies or die at night while your "friends" are running away laughing cause you missed a door ! Techland also made interesting day/night mechanics, hunt the day, cry hide during the night. But for the bravest ones, fighting at night brings you double experience ! More details in game ;p.Give it a shot, Dying Light won't deceive you.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
ry 9, 2015
												If you are looking for a good story, or at least one that isn't inexcusably cliché at every single opportunity, as well as solid/likeable characters- look elsewhere. With that said, what Dying Light lacks in story and exciting quests, it makes up for with its absolutely brilliant co-op parkour fun. There is much fun to be had when running around and exploring this city with your friends, especially once you begin to level up different skills and obtain stronger weapons to help you mow through the large zombie counts.The graphics were a little muddy, but that was easily forgettable after an hour or two of gameplay. Additionally, the damage you deal to zombies was exquisite- giving you proper visual feedback of the damage that you are dealing versus obviously predetermined death animations.All things considered- this game has many high and many low points. If you liked Dead Island's gameplay, you will love this game as it is a logical upgrade to the development team's previous work. I would recommend Dying Light if you have a group of friends to play with, but I would hesitate to recommend it if you are just playing on playing the game solo.7/10

												My review is more for people who are not sure how it will run. I've used msi afterburner to monitor how much RAM and video memory is used.First my setup.i5 4670k OC 4.5GHzEVGA GTX 760 4GB overclocked8GB DDR3 RAMWindows 7 64. I'm running this game at 1920x1080p. with all settings maxed OTHER then AA which is off and FOV is about 35-40% everything is turned on and set to high/very high for shadows. Running at 45-60FPS. The game uses 3.2GB of Video memory and 6GB of RAM from what I have monitored. So there 2GB recommended is pretty much a lie. Now as for the game it's very fun. Just think of Dead Island meets mirror's egde. At night is really not all that scary and you can very easily just run pass all the crazy zombies that come out. Literally the have a field of view indicated on your map so you can just run pass them all so long as you stay out of the fov lol. I have yet to beat the game or put any real time in so I cant review the game that much. I just wanted to get how the game runs and what it really uses for specs.

content:
ry 7, 2015
												Review is based on few hours of gameplay in co-op and solo.First of all Dying light looks amazing  and the atmosphere is spot on. Reminds a lot like earlier first person zombie games but the free running element adds a lot more into the gameplay. The free running gets a lot more fun via perks for example you can vault off a zombie and dropkick another in mid air. You can jump from pretty high up without dying only if there is a convenient trash dump to land on.Melee weapons tend to break quite fast and they can only be fixed 4-6 times depending on the quality of the weapon. Weapon modification is nice also, you can add electric damage, burning, toxic etc..or better handling or even durability.Crafting is easy and you tend to find a lot of materials lying around to make medkits, molotov's, lockpicks etc.When the city gets dark the game gets creepier, adds a bit more difficulty and different gameplay. Some of the quests require you to do them in the night and offer good rewards. You get a lot more experience when playing in night mode and have higher stats also.Co-op is super fun with friends! There is nothing more satisfying than ganging up on zombies with human players. You can advance in the story mode in co-op just like in solo campaign.Be the zombie-mode doesn't really work yet. It won't connect to any games.Developers are adding modding tools later! +++

content:
ry 4, 2015
												Take the best parts of Far Cry 3, Mirror's Edge, and your favorite zombie apocalypse game. Add in 4-player co-op, and invasions a la Dark Souls 2, and you've got a recipe for a great time.  I had heard about this game briefly back when it was announced and was so burned out on the zombie thing by then, I didn't think to give it a second look. When it was released, I remembered what I had heard, and after reading that it had co-op and invasions, decided I had to have it.I jumped into the story really not having any clue what the game was about, apart from zombies, and while it's not the most exciting, original, or believable thing, it was enough to draw me into the game and get me on a path to where I cared enough about the characters I met early on to keep going. It pretty much stayed that way throughout. - nothing that I was super enthralled in, but enough to keep me going. The big thing throughout the game is the day/night cycle and the difference between the two. After the tutorial and first major quest, you'll understand what I mean.  I don't want to ruin the fun.The parkour-esque aspect of the game felt as good, if not better, than Mirror's Edge. Running, jumping, sliding, climbing, grappling, it's all really fluid and feels really well. Your character gets tired when it makes sense and, while there are some questionably inhuman feats, most of what you're able to do is believable apart from maybe some of the grappling stuff.The combat feels great. Early on it can be a bit weird as you get used to the combat stamina mechanic and learn how much you can dish out before you need to take a breather, but overall it is very smooth and oddly satisfying when you bust open, chop off, or stomp on someone's/something's head.  The gunplay isn't bad either, it's about what you'd expect from something like this. There aren't but a few gun options in the game, most of which are pretty uniform throughout. If there are upgrades or options to them, I haven't found them yet.  That said, guns aren't usually the best idea anyway, as the noise can attract some pretty unfriendly folks.The multiplayer is really satisfying. Co-op takes the singleplayer experience to a new level. It lets you drop in/out of friends games, and vice versa, and let's you help each other advance the story, create friendly competitions, or just go on zombie squashing rampages together.   If you enable Hunter Invasions, other players can invade your game as a super crazy "Night Hunter" zombie and try and track down you and/or your buddies in a race to kill you before you can destroy all of its nests around town.  If you win, you get some xp and cool stuff, and if the zombie wins, it gets stronger and stronger. TL;DR - If you like ANY of the games I mentioned in the first sentence, take a small look at this. If you like everything I mentioned, get this game. You probably won't be disappointed. I know I wasn't.  Good night. Good luck.

content:
ry 6, 2015
												I played through Dead Island, and wasn't expecting much from the same creator. But this game is overwhelmingly well done. It's visuals are incredibly good on both a technical and artistic level. Every frame could be it's own painting, every screenshot looks too good to be true - but they are.After I calmed down a bit about how good it looked, I realized I was having a ton of fun. Not just "hey this is neat", but actually enjoying it. The melee combat is exceptionally good, and never once did I feel like something should have connected but didn't, or should have been a headshot but wasn't. I love to complain, but I couldn't find a bug with the melee. The guns, when they came out, felt balanced and useful (using them risks attracting more dangerous zombies, ammo is limited, headshots are required), but I was a little let down that guns were so reliable. Melee weapons need to be repaired and replaced constantly, meaning you never get attached to even the most awesome butchering knife - but your gun is forever.I'm just going to gush for a second, because there's a lot to love about this game. The parkour is seamless, I never felt gypped by it, and it genuinely takes skill to use, but doesn't feel prohibitively hard. The fact that you have to replace your weapons constantly is excellent, it made every loot drop feel like it could be useful - not just "I've already got the best weapon I can have". Dismembering, defenestrating, and beating zombies continues to be fun, especially at later levels with swords that can behead many zombies at once if you execute the swing correctly. Nighttime presents a genuine challenge with serious rewards, and I actually avoided nighttime for many levels, simply because I didn't think I'd survive. A lot of games just present unwinnable situations and force you to hide, but the nights in Dying Light are genuinely survivable, and a huge rush to experience. It's a *challenge*, not an unwinnable situation. The coop is perfectly integrated, you can pick a save (a "character") to join in with your friends, and it acts just like it should. Not laggy, you both share quests and progress on your characters, voice chat exists (if a bit quiet), and nothing even looks strange about it. I coop'd 70% of the game.You know what? I can't even think of anything to complain about. Seriously, I whine about the smallest details, but Dying Light doesn't have a single flaw as far as I can tell. It took on an enormous amount of gameplay challenges that no game before it has managed to combine - and absolutely crushed it.Maybe with time I'll get jaded and talk about how some future game did it better than DL, but for today - this is the finest game you can buy.

												It is a successor to the dead island franchise, or at least it feels like it.... if you like dead island 1 or 2, you will going to love this game, if you do not, beware.That aside, this game is great.... it feels a jump to the moon in comparison with the dead island games.Graphics are amazing.... you can't get more next gen than this right now.... very realistic and with amazing effects, which run just great on my laptop.... yes, laptop friendly, if you have a decent graphics card in it.Gameplay is, like I said, very similar to dead island, scavanging for weapons, fixing them, upgrading them, leveling up and unlocking abilities, so the mechanics are basically the same, with cool weapons and abilities.They also added pretty cool parkour moves to the game mechanics, and this makes it sooo amazing... you just can't get enough jumping and stomping zombies.Story is a little weak, and the side missions feel like part of the story, but they distract you from advancing, to a point, that you can't tell when a story is side mission or storyline.This is not the best zombie story out there, but it is good.This game feel very long... I feel like I've played forever, between side missions and main story, and I'm far from halfway of the story... so it is worth the money, since you will be getting long hours, if you are completionist.Zombies, violence, drugs and gore... if you are cool with that, I recommend it.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
ry 4, 2015
												Take the best parts of Far Cry 3, Mirror's Edge, and your favorite zombie apocalypse game. Add in 4-player co-op, and invasions a la Dark Souls 2, and you've got a recipe for a great time.  I had heard about this game briefly back when it was announced and was so burned out on the zombie thing by then, I didn't think to give it a second look. When it was released, I remembered what I had heard, and after reading that it had co-op and invasions, decided I had to have it.I jumped into the story really not having any clue what the game was about, apart from zombies, and while it's not the most exciting, original, or believable thing, it was enough to draw me into the game and get me on a path to where I cared enough about the characters I met early on to keep going. It pretty much stayed that way throughout. - nothing that I was super enthralled in, but enough to keep me going. The big thing throughout the game is the day/night cycle and the difference between the two. After the tutorial and first major quest, you'll understand what I mean.  I don't want to ruin the fun.The parkour-esque aspect of the game felt as good, if not better, than Mirror's Edge. Running, jumping, sliding, climbing, grappling, it's all really fluid and feels really well. Your character gets tired when it makes sense and, while there are some questionably inhuman feats, most of what you're able to do is believable apart from maybe some of the grappling stuff.The combat feels great. Early on it can be a bit weird as you get used to the combat stamina mechanic and learn how much you can dish out before you need to take a breather, but overall it is very smooth and oddly satisfying when you bust open, chop off, or stomp on someone's/something's head.  The gunplay isn't bad either, it's about what you'd expect from something like this. There aren't but a few gun options in the game, most of which are pretty uniform throughout. If there are upgrades or options to them, I haven't found them yet.  That said, guns aren't usually the best idea anyway, as the noise can attract some pretty unfriendly folks.The multiplayer is really satisfying. Co-op takes the singleplayer experience to a new level. It lets you drop in/out of friends games, and vice versa, and let's you help each other advance the story, create friendly competitions, or just go on zombie squashing rampages together.   If you enable Hunter Invasions, other players can invade your game as a super crazy "Night Hunter" zombie and try and track down you and/or your buddies in a race to kill you before you can destroy all of its nests around town.  If you win, you get some xp and cool stuff, and if the zombie wins, it gets stronger and stronger. TL;DR - If you like ANY of the games I mentioned in the first sentence, take a small look at this. If you like everything I mentioned, get this game. You probably won't be disappointed. I know I wasn't.  Good night. Good luck.

content:
ry 4, 2015
												Pros:-Dropkick-Excellent parkour system that encourages exploration-Combat is visceral and there is a feeling of weight behind your attacks-Great atmosphere during both day and NIGHT-Nighttime is amazingly fun and tense-Soundtrack is very well done as well as overall game sound-Co-op is a ton of fun as well as the competitive multiplayer mode-Tons of sidequests-Zombies are an actual threat (especially early on)-Loot system really makes you want to explore every nook and cranny -The skill trees are expansive and gives you access to a ton of fun and unique abilitiesCons:-Performance problems-Story is fun but mostly predictable-Occasional visual glitches but nothing gamebreakingThis game is just fun. Plain and simple. If you have liked any zombie themed game/movie/show ever, get this game. It's the best one out there.  By day you are happily running and jumping around the city of Harran, a quarantined zone somewhere in the Middle-East. The zombies are usually easily outrun provided you are paying attention. When night falls though, the game basically turns into a survival horror.  The normal biters you fight during the day have the opportunity to turn into Virals, which are much faster, stronger and athletic.  There is no killing packs of zombies at night; you just have to run for your life...and don't look back ;)9/10

One of the best aspects of the game is that it evolves from escaping zombies on the rooftops to destroying every one that moves. That sense of constant progression and satisfaction is there all the time and it is wildly addicting to say the least. This is definitely an early game of the year contestant and I'm genuinely exctied to see what kind of DLC is coming to expand on the world.

content:
ry 24
												My expectations were fairly high going in to this game - and I was not disappointed.I had watched a couple of streams of people playing this game with their friends, and thought that it looked like a lot of fun, so I finally managed to talk my friend (who does not like zombie games) into playing it with me. And we definitely had fun.The story revolves around you, an agent/soldier type guy who is sent into a city which has been sealed off as a result of a zombie outbreak, in order to find some important research documents. While on this mission you meet some nice (and some not so nice) people, as well as learn some new things about the people you are working for.The story is maybe nothing too original, but the gameplay is where this game really shines, and I'll try to mention all the (in my opinion) most important things.- The weapons. You can fight your way through zombies using a wide range of weapons, from swords, daggers, clubs, guns, rifles, bows,  fists... You name it. Weapons can be found, crafted or bought, upgraded, sold... However, all weapons will eventually break.- The enemies. There are plenty of enemies, from the regular slow zombies to fast zombies, exploding zombies, huge, charging zombies - and the worst ones of them all, the "night zombies". The difference between night and day in this game is, well, like night and day. During the day you might feel safe, but during the night? Be sure to keep a bunch of flares on you and do not stop running.- The Grappling Hook. Once you get this item, the game changes completely. You are no longer limited to running and juming. You can zip around all over town, escaping zombies or reaching the roof of tall buildings much more easily. You can also use it as a (not very efficient) weapon. I love this item.- The Following. This expansion was also a lot of fun. You get access to a car, and let me tell you, driving around mowing down zombies is way more fun than it should be. Honestly, who needs a sword or a gun when you have a car? One thing that I missed when playing The Following was the ability to zip from building to building, as there are not that many buildings out there on the countryside where the expansion takes place. But then again, who needs buildings when you have a car.- The other DLCs. I enjoyed the parkour challenge DLC, however I didn't really enjoy the Bozak Horde survival challenge DLC. But these DLCs are not really mandatory, and you can choose to skip them all together if you don't want to do them (and don't care about achievements).I played this game with my friend from start to finish, and I really recommend playing it coop with someone, either a friend or just someone online. However it is completely possible to finish the game alone, so even people who prefer single player should definitely give the game a shot. Just be careful, especially during nighttime, as you won't have anyone to watch your back.Highly recommended!

content:
, 2016
												It may be squalid and zombie-infested, but Dying Light's city of Harran isn't a depressing wasteland – it's a vibrant, ambitious, open-world playground. Here, buildings are for climbing, the undead are there to be destroyed in creative ways, and there's always something interesting to be discovered nearby. It takes a while for that to become clear, though; at first, you might even think Dying Light is really about running scared from mobs of seemingly unconquerable zombies, who can quickly drain your stamina and wear out your improvised weapons. Don't be fooled.

content:
ry 15, 2015
												Before thinking of buying it, ask yourself:1. Will my computer able to handle it? (Check minimum requirement)    - Its true you will experience framerate drop/lags  if you an AMD user. Other graphic card user especially Nvidia       are safe from what I have heard.     - If you an AMD user, don't worry. Why, I'm a AMD user myself and look I have around 42.7 hours of gameplay. Yes I'm        enjoying the game. How? Well there this mod called "Dying Light Manager Tool" which you can search for it and        download yourself. Its improve your fps quite good but kill the atmospheric feeling (depend on what you disable). 2. How scary is the game?     - Morning no, night no. Why both no, because I already used to the volatiles+fast zombies chasing after me and        +hordes blocking my path while been chase, +crossing path with a special brute hulk-like zombies that can litterally         send you flying, +toad that bombard you with green slimy ball like goo that explode, +high building , +screamer         that sing heavy metal if you unlucky enter his/her room (not to make fun of screamer b'cause you know.. I won't spoil what it really is) which attract more hungry volatiles and zombies to party. All of it happen in 1 night and I will 100%         will never do it again! Ever!! Ah but alas, some mission require nightime...      - Do not worry, you can sneak, you can hide, go swimming, distract, use trap or just stick to the high ground.       - But yes being chase is really fun, even so I always avoid it. Still its really fun. The surge of adrenaline, yeaaa~~      - Cut the story short, morning you are a hunter but at night you just a helpless bunny. You can't avoid nightime         bunny, the game won't let you. You'll get used to it lol, after a while spending in nightime. 3. Enemy varieties? (ps. I forgot some of the special enemies name)    - Biters (Everyday zombies, aren't same. Some are stronger, some fast, some carry weapon and some more annoying      than the others).    - Hazmat suit zombies (Zombies that you can turn them into a flying zombie rocket, if you hit the tank on his back).    - Running zombies (Forgot the name, but man they are fast, able to catch up to you, can climb up buildings and can        decrease your health very fast but they die easily if you use a damaging weapons).    - Toad (Weird zombie that spit out acid, dangerous but weak, skrimisher zombies will run away if you get close).    -  Huge zombie that have a.. club-like weapon (Send you flying by smashing the ground with his club).    -  Huge charging zombie (Charge at you, throw huge chunk of sement/road/rock at you.. plus its accurate).    -  Screamer (Scream at you, damaging and attract closeby zombies and.. yea won't spoil what it really is if you still         didn't know).    - Bomber (VERY VERY VERY annoying, sometimes it will pop out VERY close to you when inside building, due to        instinct you'll automatically attack it leading to KABOOMM and of course kill you. Maybe it just me, cause I litterally       attack anything that ganno jump scare at me).    - Volatile (Now this zombies ooh man, they are the top tier zombies. Best of the best killer, very fast, strong, can        climb up building, can also spit acid for range attack and it fast and damaging but don't worry it only spit acid if it       cant get to you. Only come out at night, and same as every zombies you can kill it, make it vulnerable first with uv light then attack with your top weapon, or just run away for your life as there are dozen of them during the night).     - Night hunter (Control by players, only come out if you enable it on the online setting and of course make your game         visible online. How dangerous is this night hunter is entirely depend on the players that controlling it).     - Bolter (Fast son of zombicth, yes faster than any zombie but doesn't attack, if you able to catch it, you'll get a         crafting material, only come out at night).      -  Also, Rais's thugs (Melee and range) and hostile survivors. Which is human.4. Type of weapons?    - Yes there a variety of weapons. Blade, blunt, piercing and guns. Except guns, as there only 3 type of pistols and 2       type of rifles.    - Don't worry, you'll fine a lot of different blade, blunt and piercing melee weapons.     - Oh there also special weapons, exm Rais's pistol. Orange quality and high damage. Aquire by doing side mission.     - You can craft many stuff that can be use as weapons, distraction, booster, medkit, lockpick, flares and shield.    - Most best weapons out there are usually at the store. 5. Weapons Cuztomization?    - You need to fine blueprint to be able to cuztomize your melee weapons to add extra stats. Sadly you can't customize       guns.     - You can add flame, electric, toxic/poison, impact, bleeding effect which sometimes can lead to some funny moment.    - You can add some upgrade for your melee weapons for some extra stats. 6. What about the skill tree? (I only tell some of it)     - There are 3 skill tree. Survivor, agility and power     -  Investing in Survivor, will of course increase your chances to survive as you need Some perk from survival skill tree         to be able to craft stuff such as medkit and flares (flares is important during nightime as it able to temporaly scare         off volatile from chasing you and very important for protecting you from night hunter 1 hit kill pounch).     - While investing in Agility, will unlock more parkour move such as sliding, vaulting a zombie and more. Also it         increase your running duration. No you can't run forever but you can parkour and clinging on the edge of a building        forever.     - In Power skill tree, you'll able to unlock some special attack. Such as throwing your melee weapon, yes you need       to invest in Power to be able to throw your weapon. Also the 360 spinning attack, 2-handed weapon needed. Also        you will last longer before running out of stamina.7. How beautiful is the game graphic?     - Youtube can answer your question. Its better to see it for yourself rather than looking at "abdcdefg". Each of us        have different taste. But lemme tell you, its very atmospheric.8.  The story?      - You'll get emotional sometimes. Overall its a good story, for me at least.9.  Other stuff:      - You can play co-op. Yes you can chat also.      - You can use the environment to kill zombies. (Require logic, such as using fire cracker to light up leaked fuel).           Mother nature will help you sometime by blowng off zombies toward spikes,      - Zombies can't swim except night hunter.      - This game sometimes surprise you.       - Totally recommend if you afraid of height. I insist.       - I forgot about combat. Well lemme just say, its fun, a lot of gore, you can burn people and zombies alike,           decapitate, cut both zombie legs and watch it crawl to you, cut their head, blow them up is also an option.           Literally slice someone in half, yes the decapitation is gruesome. Please hide from your parents before playing if           you still a little boy/girl.        - Hook blade is evil, I REPEAT!! HOOK blade IS EVILLL!!!!        - Sliding zombies on the rooftop near the edge is a great way to fast travel to any safehouse.The only thing that I don't like about this game is, its not AMD userfriendly.

Game industry could use some fresh blood, probably.But this game is pretty good. A lot of really nice ways to deal with your enemies.This game isn't infected with that racial/pc/feminazi ♥♥♥♥. There are even zombie children here (and they are pretty awesome).Parkour is good. You really feel that your character has weight and strengh, unlike in ME where all that jumping was arcade-ish as hell like it was Mario or something.Modifications are nicely animated. Just don't get attached to your weapon.Day and night cycle is very well done, so you'll be entertained, that's for sure.Almost forgot: bombers will make you ♥♥♥♥♥ your pants. And then you'll die.Good night, good luck.

content:
y 30, 2015
												To be honest I didnt't expect too much from this game, but the small expectations I did have was blown out of the back yard.This game combines the wondergull arts of parkour and brutal "mano y mano" melee battle. The combat system is good for a First person fighting/shooter zombie game. You have dodging, power attacks and devestating power slams, all very satisfying to use.The graphics are good and only as some minor performance issues when a lot of stuff is happening.The animations are good (at least better than "Dead Island") and work well.Gamplay is fun and entertaining as both looting, running and fighting is a part of your daily scedule. (Mostly running at night. Damned "Nightmares"..)A minor flaw is the side quests, that are mostly boring fetch quests, or do this, do that, ect. But the story in itself is enjoyable.The crafting/upgrading system is ok, but could have been a bit more in depth.Guns are rare and act like guns should do, like alerting every single zombie in the area.. Yeah..All in all, I really enjoy this game.Would rate it 9/10. Good job guys.

y 30, 2015
												I'm re-writing this review from something stupid to something like an actual review. So Here we go, don't judge me I'm not the greatest at writing reviews.What I liked:I loved the story I got attached to a few of the characters and cried once in this entire game, thats all the spoilers your going to get! Crafting is in the game, and it makes looting actually almost a must if you want to have a better weapon. Parkour in this is game might be wierd at first but once you play for a few hours you will be a ninja or close to it... maybe. Co-op is a thing, which I probably would have played the game for as long as I have if it wasn't for co-op it makes the game ten times more fun there is no doubt about it. (Short break another paragraph)Special zombies/infected are a thing, so your not just taking heads of a bunch of normal zombies the entire game, trust be if it was like that it'd be boring. AI, the ai are very smart. Becuase of sound mainly, if you shoot a gun, they'll turn their heads and come to look, or some runners will come sprinting around corners. Sounds, game sounds amazing not much detail I can go into that though. Speaking of detail this game has amazing graphics, why can't every game look like this and get the same FPS?DLC, they have added three DLC not sure how many they plan to add, but I'm going to write a small review of Bozak. It is very, very, very, very hard! You have three lives to get through 19(ish) trails, if you fail a trail you lose a life and have to restart on said trail. EX: if you fail on trail 2, and lose a life, you will restart you next life on trail 2, not one. Which almost every trail has a count down of 30 seconds after 30 seconds so aprox. 1 min to clear said trail which can not be enough in some cases...Some things I don't like..I don't know I'll have to think of somethings... Will be updated.

content:
, 2015
												In Dying Light, a first-person, action survival horror game, players must use everything in their power to survive until the morning's first light in a vast open world filled with danger. During the day, players will traverse an expansive urban environment overrun by a vicious outbreak, scavenging the world for supplies and crafting weapons to defend against the growing infected population. At night, the hunter becomes the hunted, as the infected become aggressive and more dangerous. Most frightening are the predators which only appear after sundown.

content:
9, 2015
The Short:I haven’t played a game like this in years, for a developer to be able to pull off so much exhilarating tension in a game is amazing. You will never forget your first few nights surviving in this game, that’s a guarantee.Techland improved on everything since Dead Island. The Story, combat, movement, graphics, audio and voice acting, all are better in every single way and this is a worthy addition to the next gen portfolio of games.The Long:Many people say that Dying Light is what Dead Island should have been, and that’s true. So if you liked Dead Island but wanted a little more, then this is what you wanted all along. If you never tried Dead Island before and wanted to delve into this genre, then Dying Light is a great place to start.I still enjoyed both Dead Islands but wished there was more to them, for the story to be a little more convincing, for the voices and acting to be a tad less comical and out of place. Gameplay wise the characters felt very much grounded, the cars felt unnecessary and the exploration of an ‘open world’ wasn’t rewarding enough. Still, as a game where you can break a zombies arms and watch it flail at you was hilarious, not to mention the level of gory detail one could open up on a zombie with the myriad of weapons sprawled across the game world.Luckily for Dying Light, Techland upped the ante on everything and it’s a joyride you have to experience for yourself. Graphically this game just looks amazing, many times catching me off guard with just how beautiful the city vistas are when traversing across rooftops with a sunset ahead of me, then getting reminded through the earpiece that the night is fast approaching, the alarm on your watch goes off indicating things are about to get down, howls of infected erupting around you as you realise you’re nowhere near a safe house – you start running for your life. The Day/Night cycles really change the dynamic of the game and how you play and it truly makes the game.The audio is great too, both for the Zombies and humans. Dialogue feels part of the game world and setting; you can hear the desperation, anger and loss of hope portrayed through the voice actors.  Being chased is also thrilling, the music kicks in with some serious beats, your character begins to breathe heavier as you vault a wall and then scramble up another in an attempt to save yourself from whatever it is that is howling behind you, claws scraping at your shoes as a panic sets in that something is already on the roof ahead of you.The storyline is good enough, it may seem a little clichéd to some but it serves the setting well and throws you deeper into the city of Harran. I won’t say much more on this other than the fact that by seeing your arms and legs interact with the environment really adds to the immersion, even more so during the main story.Gameplay wise, the addition of parkour into the game was a brilliant idea. Being able to move up and over objects, onto overpasses, through apartment blocks, busses and over zombies makes you feel liberated from a typical corridor shooter, free to explore any nook and cranny. Crafting is the same as in the previous Dead Island titles, find/learn blueprints, find components and a weapon then put it all together and you end up with a katana pulsating with electricity and fire.The combat feels very fluid and kinetic. When you connect your wrench with a Zombies head and the dull crack of its skull resonates loudly as it staggers backwards feels very satisfying to say the least, until its friend hugs you from behind reminding you to always keep an eye on your six. The physics also add to the combat hilariously as you watch zombies flung high in the air severed at the waist by an exploding propane tank.  Still not convinced or on the fence about it? Look at the screenshots and videos of the game, they don’t lie, and it’s even better playing it.End notes:The game did initially run like a dog on most systems but performance has since been heavily improved via patches and runs very well now.If it’s your first time, don’t rush through with others, power levelling will only max you out and zombies will fold under your awesome stats in a single hit taking away any challenge (unless you’re into that sort of thing). The game scales difficulty very well and the early stages are amongst the most enjoyable. Surviving actually feels like that.End-game is a little sparse on content at the moment. Techland have added a new tier of weapons (legendary) to keep things interesting. It is a grind to get them but at least that’s something. They’ve also added new parkour challenges and there’s the presence of quarantine zones too to explore. You won’t get bored of killing zombies, but (Techland if you’re reading this) an infinite level up system (similar to Diablo 3) could at least provide those with maxed out stats a progress bar to fill up so that all the running and gunning gets accounted for somewhere, provides some semblance of continual progression even when all quests have dried up.DLC – A hit and a miss, but mostly a miss at this stage. Personally, the price does not justify the content of what’s been released so far (skins, blueprints etc). Bozak’s Horde does add a cool bow weapon, but the stress and brutal difficulty associated with completing the challenges to get it are too much for a good chunk of gamers (even if it only takes around 30 minutes to complete). Personally though, if you enjoy the game a lot and can get the season pass on sale, the extra content does add some longevity (if only by a bit at the moment). I’m definitely looking forward to future content though.Mods – Will hopefully carry this game longer than Techland expect it to. Some really promising levels are out already and the community are only getting started.

content:
5, 2015
												Just finished the game today. Really enjoyed it. It is pretty similar to Dead Island with the biggest difference being the vertical aspect of movement that Dead Island lacked. Parkour is a lot of fun and is similar to Mirror's Edge. The world is huge and open. Just about every building can be entered and explored. Loot is everywhere. Combat is fun. Crafting is fun. The quests are fun. Challenges are fun. Movement is fun. Almost everything about this game is simply fun.The storyline is really good as well and is lengthy. I logged 57 hours in the game and left out some of the stuff you can do although I feel confident that I covered almost all of it.I really only had 2 complaints. The first is that my frame rate would dip when one of the spitting special zombies would hit me in the face with spit. Possibly correctable with tweaked settings and/or improved hardware. The other is the "water blur" effect on the screen any time you get wet. It's super annoying and makes it nearly impossible to see anything for a good 5 seconds after you get out of the water.All in all I really enjoyed this game. It's fun just to run/parkour around the city. It almost becomes an art form after you get the hang of it. Well done, Techland!

content:
ry 10, 2015
												Dying Light is a zombie game which isn't shy of upholding cliches but does so in a fun and innovative way. Comparing the game to Dead Island (: Riptide) the game has fixed a lot of the core flaws and completely rebooted the story in a new setting with new parkour mechanics. The game does this very well, you start up with a character which is fumbling around in the dark, has no idea what to do and your parkouring still has to evolve. The pacing is really good for the first few hours. However this turns into disaster real quick. If you start co-op and do a few side-quests, your leveling will lead you to overpowered skills much too fast, obliberating minibosses with a few hits while that shouldn't feel possible as it makes the kills majorly disappointing. It goes from bad to normal to holy ♥♥♥♥ I'm a biotic spiderman with guns parkour, which is fun for new players to the freerunning scene but doesn't feel as fun for the purist parkour-only Mirror's Edge players.The story, as-is, is a bit lackluster. It doesn't include backstory (just a bit in the side-quests) and you don't really feel as if you're involved in a greater world with a lot of things going on. The architecture and levels reflect this, have a lot of conflicting design choices. Of course, this is Techland and they did not think this through, no biggie, the gameplay makes up for it. Smashing zombies in and running around the place with the day-night mechanics makes for a very fun game where you just want to run around and explore every inch.Even though the scaling isn't brilliant and the story isn't up to par, the gameplay, gunplay, graphics are all awesome and fun. If you can see through the 00's zombie action movie cliches, love blowing ♥♥♥♥ up with your fists and traps and you really like freedom of movement in a game, Dying Light is just for you.

												This game is fun. Very fun.I'll confess, I don't know what it's like to play by yourself (apart from the first mission/tutorial mission) as I've played the game so far with my boyfriend. The co-op is very easy and works really well (unlike some coop in games like Dead Rising 3). It might take a little bit to get used to the controls/free running but once you do, the game seems pretty fluid. The missions seem fun and you get involved in the story, I even got angry at the playable character when he did something pretty scumbaggy on orders. But anyway, I would definitely recommend this game to anyone who loves zombie games. It's not as hilarious as Dead Rising 3 and not as horrifyingly scary (imo) as Dead Island games, but it's probably the most fluid one out there and if you want scary/tough, there's always the nighttime.

content:
ry 8, 2015
												Well, finished Dying Light, not going to play it again ever. Was sorta good while it lasted.Don't bother conserving weaponry, just use whatever you can find and whatever upgrades you have at the moment. By the time your weapon breaks, if it's a decent one, you'll either have found a stronger one earlier on or be easily able to buy whatever store weapon is the strongest at that time. The economy is completely broken and pretty much meaningless. Likewise you'll never run out of medkits: make them whenever you have materials, buy two every time you open the shop since they're dirt cheap, take whatever you find in airdrops. After the first 5% of the game, you'll never run out.Parkour is super fun. It's the heart of game. Be warned there are some annoying ledges-and-edges-that-turn-out-to-be-ungrabbable here and there. If it's a rock cliff, fugadaboudit. If you think 40 hours of parkour plus some simple zombie combat (the best tactic is still swing at heads with a bit of dodging, the special moves leave you vulnerable) is worth the price, get this game. I frankly got this due to not having much else to play. You may want to wait till a deal brings it to the 20 dollar mark.Don't really see how Be The Zombie can be fun. Basically you're a troll who gets killed a lot. No ladder etc.Characters are not very interesting. Your charater's voice acting is pretty decent and get entertaingly snarky here and there. Bad guy is like FC3 Vaas diluted to one part per ten parts water. Plot may not make much sense due to railroaded feelings that have nothing to do with the gamer's experience, eg massive grief over characters you literally spoke to about four times.Ending was a horrible QTE, not to mention the carbon copy of COD's famed <spoilers ahead> pull knife out of your body to stab super evil bad guy. I had no technical issues whatsoever. Of course I'm using a i3 and R9 290, so if your processor is AMD or your graphics card is less powerful, it might get tricky.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
7, 2015
												Dying Light is an open world first person zombie action game from the developers of Dead Island. I was very disappointed by Dead Island, so I almost didn't bother playing Dying Light at all, but I took a chance and it turns out that Dying Light is ... okay. Not great, but not terrible either. It has some problems but I had some fun with it and its certainly better than Dead Island.GameplayThe combat is primarily focused on melee. There are some guns (pistol, rifle, shotgun) but ammo is rare and the noise just attracts more zombies, so I only used guns on story missions against Human bandits. You can also find and craft throwable weapons such as knives, molotovs and grenades which are useful against large groups of zombies. But most of the time, you'll be using a variety of blades and blunt weapons to slice and bludgeon your way through the undead.At the start of the game, your character is very weak. The weapons do hardly any damage, it can take around ten hits to kill each zombie, and because every attack uses stamina, by the time you've killed one you're out of breath. Fighting multiple zombies together is basically impossible. So you have a tedious situation where you have to kill one, run away (combat stamina and movement stamina are different), wait for stamina to recharge, go back, kill another, repeat. You can easily avoid zombies by climbing on top of cars or buildings, but sooner or later you to have to fight, because you need the XP to get stronger.After a few hours, the combat does start to get more enjoyable. You'll unlock abilities to get more stamina and health. You'll find weapons that do alot more damage. You can unlock special moves, such as the ability to stomp on the head of a zombie lying on the ground for an instant kill. Eventually you're strong enough to kill zombies in one or two hits and you've got enough stamina to fight a horde of a dozen zombies with no problem. I tended to use alot of blades, so when I was chopping off zombie arms and heads I felt a bit like Michonne from the Walking Dead TV show.There are a few types of special zombies, although nothing we haven't seen before in other games, especially Left 4 Dead. There are spitters, exploders, chargers, and tanks. And then there are the "volatiles", who only attack at night and are really dangerous, so its best to just sneak past or run away from them. They're not too hard to kill individually, but it seems like if one sees you, every other volatile in the city is instantly alerted to your location so you end up getting swarmed. Fighting against Humans is the weakest part of combat. Especially after you've found a gun, their AI is so dumb that they provide no challenge to a veteran FPS gamer.StoryFor some reason the story never really excited me. Its kinda basic - the city of Harran has been quarantined because zombies happened and the player character, Kyle Crane, has been parachuted in to try and find research relating to a cure. There are a bunch of friendly civilians who need your help to survive and there's also a bandit leader who is evil because reasons. (It was something stupid like his brother died on the first day of the outbreak so he decided that everyone else should die as well). Most of the characters, including Crane, are lacking in personality. The voice actors did a decent job, but unfortunately the script writers just never gave them anything interesting to say.I guess I could have missed something, but if I did, its not my fault. This is one of those games that does the whole "I know you're surrounded by enemies but now this NPC is going to give you plot details over a radio even though you're not paying attention because you're trying to not die" thing. I prefer to have all the dialogue in a cutscene or at least a secure location, so that I can concentrate fully on what is being said.TechnicalGraphics are really nice, lots of detail in the buildings and environment, and performance is good. The recommended specs are quite demanding, and I'm right on the edge (I have an i7 2600K @ 3.4 Ghz, 8GB ram and a GTX 770 with 4GB vram) but I was able to maintain a mostly consistent 60 FPS without too much tweaking. I've turned off the useless stuff like motion blur, film grain and depth of field, I've got view distance turned down to around 1/4 of the bar (credit goes to Total Buscuit's port report video on Youtube for demonstrating the effect of that setting) and I've turned off Nvidia's special HBAO but left the normal version on. Everything else is on highest setting at 1920x1080. I've also forced Vsync through Nvidia control panel to eliminate screen tearing (the in game Vsync setting is useless).Sadly, there are lots of achievement bugs. Maybe not the most critical problem, but hey, I like unlocking achievements, especially after finishing a game's main story I can usually spend a few more hours achievement hunting. Most of the problems seem to be with achievements that require you to perform a certain action X number of times. I currently have seven different incomplete achievements where the counter seems to be stuck on 0 or 1, but I know I've done those actions loads of times. Meanwhile I've unlocked a coop achievement but I haven't even touched coop mode, and I unlocked two other achievements several hours before I actually performed their actions. Judging by the forums there are lots of other players experiencing similar bugs.RecommendationAs I said, despite my complaints, Dying Light is a decent game and I did have some fun with it. I think its worth playing, but I wouldn't class it as a high priority, especially if you have other games in your backlog that you're excited to play.

content:
26, 2015
												Absolutely entrancing, at least to me.  I never really could get into the Assassin's Creed II mojo, mainly because I disliked having to be stealthy so often.  And then I never really revisted that series.  Dying Light takes the parkour type movement that I did really like from AC, makes it feel even a bit more fluid like Mirror's Edge (but you do have to level up some before you're that level of competent), and combines it with combat that makes you feel powerful.Don't get me wrong, the hordes of zombies can be terrifying when you are new, because they can absolutely overwhelm you.  But later on I'm flipping over their heads and slashing skulls in half with one blow, and setting guys on fire with my insane propane-spewing hatchet-thing, and just feeling in general like a badass....and then night comes.  That whole power thing with traversal during the day is absolutely flipped on its head at night, and it's way more tense and dangerous than AC.  And this time I actualy like it, because I feel the fear of the monsters, not the ineptitude of my character.  I've already established that I'm a badass during the day, so the fact that these monsters at night practically insta-kill me if I get seen makes them all the more terrifying....and then, as you level up and as you learn more and more, suddenly you start being more powerful at night, too.  Suddenly the nights aren't quite so terrifying, and you can survive for a while if you hold your ground, heart pounding, fighting for your life but winning against the odds and having a blast doing it.  What a rush.I have never seen first-person melee combat that felt this good, to be frank.  There are some guns, but those tend to call in larger zombies (as do any other loud noises), and I preferred using melee in general.  Even when I could use throwing knives or similar, I'd avoid that at all costs.  Band of human psychos out to kill me with guns?  No problem, I'll just go from cover to cover and kill everyone with my electrified sickle.I am not a violent person, but there's something deeply cathartic here to me. ;)  I get the sort of feeling that I used to play when playing Quake II way back in the day.  This is a whole lot better, though.I have not had any technical glitches or other issues.  As soon as they make any more content, or a sequel or whatever, I'll be buying it.  It's just plain fun.

content:
14, 2015
												Dying Light: Basically Dead Island gone right as many of these reviews probably already say. I played through the whole game with a friend and I can say there wasn't a moment where I was getting bored of it, My friend and I mostly trying to avoid the main quests and mostly just screwing around/doing side quests had a blast and thought it was very unfortunate when there wren't a many side quests to do in the Old Town part, but the recent addition of Hard mode made it 10x more challenging and 10x more fun. We honestly could say we were getting bored of the game when we were able to one hit Goons, but with hard mode that was instantly fixed, even the normal zombies were made a challenge.The story focuses on Kyle Crane who is an agent sent in by the GRE to get files back from survivors who supposedly stole them, but to Crane's findings they actually were not the ones who stole them and so in turn he started helping them out, and thats pretty much how the introduction to the game starts. The story itself has a couple cliche moments but not enough to make the story predictable. There are a good amount of plot twists and parts that are honestly very sad when you realise what is happening.Overall I would rate it:8/10 Singleplayer10/10 MultiplayerSeriously, the addition of Co-op was probably the best thing this game has.My friend personally gives it:7/10 Singleplayer10/10 MultiplayerWe have gotten a full enjoyment of the game and I can say that all these hours I've spent in this game are well worth it.Thanks for reading.

												Price 35 dollars. Patch 1.5. Season pass installed. Single player only.Played in 1920x1080 on max settings. 100% complete all missions/side missions before review.Graphics 9/10 Beside some random slowdowns, gorgeous graphics.Sound 6/10 Great ambient sound. The infected sounds great. Voice acting horribleReplay value 3/10. A horrible story with paper-thin characters.Overall 8/10:I had a great time playing this game. No bugs beside some random slowdown. Did all missions/side missions in 4 gaming sessions /40 hours including the DLC missions.  Fun/Simple crafting system. Looting opportunists everywhere. A great climbing system ala Mirrors Edge. Different game play during day/night cycles. During day you can play Rambo, but during night stealth is a must.Some real annoying side mission/protection missions that re-spawned. Helping a guy sell stuff or another guy fishing during a zombie apocalypse does not seem likely. The game gets really easy when you learn how to camouflage from infected.  You can just run around and break every infected neck. There are however events during missions that will not trigger if you are camouflaged.The grabbing hook you can acquire during later parts of the game changes game play a lot. Suddenly you can just jump buildings and climb bridges with easy but during missions you are "to fatigued" to use the hook not to break game play.The game is not worth 60 dollars/50 euro full price. 30-40 is a fair value.The season pass is a bust. Dont get it. The extra missions are just more of the same.

content:
2016
												I remember waiting for this game a few years ago when it was first announced and my friend and I were looking forward to it coming out, then remembering it got delayed for a whole year and we had to wait for what felt like forever. After getting the game, it was fantastic. Looked beautiful (which is suprising for a game set in an apocalypse-like situation) but obviously graphic-wise it was and still is pretty stunning. Have played a fair amount of this game as you can see. The DLC called "The Following" was an excellent addition to the game however it really only added another 7 missions but at least it was in a whole new area with driveable vehicles. All the DLC together has added about another 100+ hours to my gameplay just by trying to do all the side missions, etc.Recommend this game to any zombie-thriller / survival fans out there. However once you play for about 25 hours it might start seeming a little boring and after the campaigns are done basically it felt to me like there was no worth anymore.Goodnight. And Good luck fellow survivors.

y 18, 2016
												If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients:1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie Directions:1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

content:
ry 8, 2015
												Developed by Techland, yup that same company that made Dead Island games, is in my opinion one of the best zombie themed game I have ever played. The key differenced between dead island and dying light is very substantial. The element of parkour (Mirror's Edge style) through an open world, leaping over obstacles and standing up on ledges rooftops but in first person view (some what Assasin's Creed style) is an extraordinarily perfect fit for this game. Unlocking safe houses and cascading up radio towers to claim them (Far Cry 3/4 style), and collecting crafting items to craft melee weapons is very satisfying. There are a few variety of pistols and rifles that you can pick up and use, but the most staisfying part of the game is seeing the dismantling of body parts with the swing of a blunt, or sharp edged weapon. Also dropkicking zombies into oblivion is the best part of it all. The replayability is suprisingly very high, because there are multiple side quests you can play solo or coop you can take on, and you can play online with other people  as a human or a zombie player is  most definitely the juiciest part of the meat. 10/10

content:
ry 8, 2015
												The Dead Island sequel we've all been waiting for! Techland improved a lot of the mechanics. The parkour addition makes the world accessible vertically and feels great. Good game for completionists looking to get the most bang for their buck.PROS:-Dead Island with parkour-Excellent skill tree progression gives the game a nice RPG feel as you level up-Tons of content for completionists-Looks awesome in motion. Very nice looking overall.-Day/Night cycles. Night time really ups the tension with special infected and higher XP gains.-Sense of verticality is unparalleled. Was never affraid of heights in a game until Dying LightCONS:-Weapon crafting/variety was much better in Dead Island. Seems like Techland went backwards in this regard.-Only one protagonist, even in multiplayer! Dead Island handled multiplayer much better.-The final encounter is single player only! (This is not a spoiler, the game tells you before you approach it.)-No vehiclesNOTE: The game has nvidia-centric features. AMD users should do some research BEFORE buying.So in a nutshell, diehard DI fans should feel right at home. Just don't expect the same refined co-op experience. Also, the game rips off iconic ideas from mainstream games like Far Cry and Assassins Creed. Not a bad thing in my book, but some may consider this a con. Lastly, expect a very cliche and predictable story. Didn't add this as a con since DI games were never going to win an award for original story telling. It's all about the side quests!I enjoyed all 43 hours of my experience and can't wait to dive back in!
