content:
ry 7, 2015
About The Game:Dying Light is a game that touches deep down into the inner soul of what makes a Zombie Apocolypse & captures every little inch of it in a very well crafted and spectacular game.Dying Light is what i call a spiritual successor of Dead Island and in many different ways beats the absolutely crap out of it, this is the game Dead Island strived to be but did not live up to the hype it created.Dying Light is developed by Techland the same guys who brought us Dead Island & published by Warner Brothers Interactive.The Story:The story behind is that a viral outbreak has accured on the city of Harran, and you the player (Kyle Krane) have been sent into the thick of it by the GRE a government organization trying to recover a document & kill the leader of a thug group who was once mayor of the city before the outbreak.Kyle is soon jumped by some thugs and after trying to dispatch of these thugs ends up being bitten by a Infected and becoming infected himself, soon after that you're on a battle of your own trying to survive and help keep the survivor group you're haulled up with alive as well as yourself.After many events, you gain a feeling of security and home with the group of survivors you are bunked up with & feel the need to seek revenge after many of them perish to the hands of Rais the traitor and eventually lose focus on your primary mission. Soon after that it becomes apparent that things aren't what they seem with the GRE and this is where the story changes drastically.The plot becomes a bit more sinister as the story goes on. You can read below for a more full story at your own risk.Full Story: (THERE ARE PLOT & STORY SPOILERS)Many of your friends have died up to this point & this creates even more hatred towards Rais, he soon attempts to take your life & in trying to do so you cut off his hand. This sends Rais into a rage and he now does everything in his power to make sure that you suffer, killing off main characters and setting up multiple traps to catch you off guard until the final battle where it's balls to the wall and you have to go back to where it all started & get the research that you worked so hard towards getting and keeping safe.The GRE contacts you several times throughout the story trying to bargain with you into getting the cure for them & offering you a free ride out of Harran if you do.Before you reach Rais for the final "showdown" you have to run a gauntlet of Volatiles & infected from the bottom of the building right to the top, this was a pretty cool idea & meant you had to confront not only danger head on but the risk of falling, before making it to the top you find a lot of Rais's men dead or dying on the lower levels of the structure, PLOT TWIST:Rais made a deal with the GRE and backstabbed the guys he had been protecting in order to ensure a safe escape for himself.The final fight takes place ontop of a crane and was a major let down, at least for me because it all consists of Quick Time Events. Nothing fun or challenging here, i mean i didn't even get to kick him off the god damn crane?! In the end you're pretty much just watching a movie.In the end you kill Rais, claim the cure & tell the GRE to go ♥♥♥♥ themselves.Note:The GRE want the cure to sell off as they plan on releasing the "Harran Virus" to the public and creating a zombie epidemic, outside of Harran making it more like a "controlled epidemic" this way they can make a profit from dirty money. Although this is the end of the story it doesn't end here. There's still much more to do in Harran.The Gameplay:The gameplay that Dying Light sets up is very solid and brings into play everything you should expect in a "Zombie Survival" game.Limited guns and ammo.Lots of running around. Plenty of parkour elements so you can scale buildings and fences to escape the clutches of the zombies.Crafting makes a return from Dead Island.Fluent and very nice Melee combat.RPG Elements to help you progress from a very under developed player into a zombie slaughtering machine.Dynamic day & night cycles. (That drastically alter gameplay & difficulty.)Dynamic weather. (That actually affects gameplay for both you and the enemy.)A full sandbox playground for you to slaughter countless zombies in with no timelimit.Play as the Zombie & invade other players games to slaughter them as they try to survive.Many more things to keep you preoccupied and leave the sensation of never having enough.There's just so much content packed into this game that Dead Island lacked and it's fantastic! I could go on but alas i have limited space to write this review.The Verdict:Dying Light is a HUGE step up from the disappointment that was Dead Island, Techland really stepped up their game with this one and made a fantastic leap in the right direction.I cannot remember the last game except The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim that has entertained me so much to the point where i spend countless hours ingame not bored and not wanting to quit, the usual, just a little bit longer excuse, this game is fantastic and i REALLY applaud Techland for learning from their mistakes and giving us the Zombie Sandbox we've wanted for years!Although this game is a fantastic game at it's core it's also got A LOT of problems that you need to know about before you buy it so please read here:Bad Things:This game is a system hog, (Patch 1.0.4 has fixed this issue but could still be present on older PC's.)Unless you've got a powerful computer don't expect to run this at full settings. My system runs it fine except for a few problems which i will list below.If you do have a powerful system like mine then you're in luck you'll be able to enjoy the game in all it's glory and the wonderful graphics that it has, however.NO MULTI-CORE SUPPORT! (Patch 1.0.4 fixed a lot of the lag issues i recieved, however Multi-Core support still isn't present)What the hell Techland? Are you serious it's 2015, what were you thinking? Inexcusable but at least the game is running smoothly now thanks to 1.0.4 patch.The game has a fair amount of bugs in it and needed time to be ironed out before release. However Techland is releasing fixes for what bugs it has and this is good!Falling out of the map.Zombies spawning inside the map and becoming stuck.AI spotting you through walls & ceilings.These are minor things but are as inexcusable as no multi-core support because all it takes is another week or month to fix these things.The Rating:Finally with all that said and done i come to my rating. This is a tough one & to be honest i am going to have to give this a good 8/10 and here's why.The game itself is as i said the most fun i've had from a Triple A title since Skyrim, however there are a few issues.The falling out of the map or the AI stuck in the map are things i can live with, i cannot live with broken stealth mechanics though, that's frustraiting and should be fixed ASAP as well as the Multi-core support.I still recommend this game but be aware of the few issues that need patching and think wisely before picking this one up if you're still not 100% sure.NOTE: As of Patch 1.0.4 today 15/2/2015 the Frame Skips & video lag has been resolved and as such my score for this game has increased to an 8/10. Thank You Techland!Edit 2: With each patch this game becomes even more recommendable by me. If you see this game drop in price do not hesitate to pick it up! New patches release fairly regularly and offer free content which means, maps, weapons & more!

content:
ry 4, 2015
												After finishing the game, figured I'd give a short review.The game definately has some downfalls, but it can also be very fun at times. If you're looking for a game that has a good story, this is NOT one of them. Pros:- Amazing zombie killing mechanics. Slo-mo head explosions, decapatations, amputations, and thousands of creative ways to murder a zombie.- Creative, different zombie types.- Awesome night time gameplay, truly terrifying.- Great difficulty scaling. Fighting a zombie horde is actually something you may need to avoid, as a situation can turn from a fun zombie killing spree to being eaten alive.- Fantastically fun to play online as a zombie, and even better to play the Co-op campaign.- Weapon crafting is creative, and adds a lot of substance. The ability to modify stats is an added bonus.- Side quests and the open world aspects presented after you have completed the game means you get about a hundred hours of gameplay, depending on how much you like murdering the undead.- Lots to do!Cons:- The game itself isn't optimized very efficiently. Some areas drop your FPS considerably, and in general, using hardware that normally allowed you to play AAA titles on high will only net you a Medium-High. (Tip- Turn down View Distance, it has little impact on gameplay since its mostly Melee). I assume this will be fixed by patches.- Storyline is bland and predictable, the game's attempt at creating an emotional attachment to characters laughably falls through, and you soon find yourself forgetting the names that reappear or are mentioned mid to late game. Most campaign missions put you through mazes, or a generally recycled premises. (Like how many times do you have to be stripped of your weapons? Every single major encounter.)- The parkour mechanics need some work, prepare to fall to your death a few times when your character grabs onto a beam, only to scale and jump over it (Not a good idea on high heights) or even fail to grab a ledge altogether. The grappling hook is pretty.. Interesting too.- The minimap is terrible. Using the indicator to find quest locations. safehouses, etc results in frustration. - There's really no use for money. You can accumulate great amounts, but the weapons sold by the shop tend to be worse than your current- or only 30 minutes away from finding it on a dead guy.In summary :Don't buy the game for it's storyline. It sucks. Other than that, if you just want something to play with your friends then it is a great choice. Or if you just like the good old zombie killing action. Most other issues, like poor optimization and weird parkour mechanics, can be fixed through patches.For what its worth, I'd rate it6.5/10

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
ry 5, 2015
												To start off, the parkour is very well done.  Less restrictive and glitchy than Assassin's Creed.  -The gameplay is very similar to Dead Island, a little too similar.  You can see shared animations between the two games, which isn't necessarily a bad thing in this case.  -The shooter segments are pretty poorly done to be honest.  There aren't many guns, but they aren't very useful anyway.  Why are there different values and colors for guns that have identical stats and skins??? The animations are just as funky as Dead Island in terms of guns.  If there were suppressors, then maybe it would have a bit more depth.  -PLEASE OPTIMIZE YOUR GAME BEFORE RELEASE!!! I had to knock down the graphics to 720p and everything else on low just to get ~30-40 FPS.  This should not be happening on a GTX 760!! It's not the most powerful card, but it sure can handle a lot more than this game looks.  This is a PC!! 60 FPS is the minimum expectation on low settings with a reasonable rig! This isn't a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ console!! *SPOILER ALERT*- The story is meh at best.  I'm not sure if there was supposed to be a little romance between Crane and Jade.  Some cutscenes are illogical and out of place.  Cut his hand off, but let him live to extend the story?  Insert a far cry 3/4 hallucination level which honestly doesn't make much sense.  I don't think everyone infected traveled through a floating wonder world before they ate someone. It is also SUPER predictable. I was not surprised at any point. I'm not sure if I was supposed to be either.-The voice acting is ok, could use a little more authenticity in their vocals.  Sometimes they don't show much emotion, as if they're reading someone else's script (that's pretty much what they do anyway).  Bioshock infinite is an example of voice acting done right.- Some of the crafting doesn't make much sense.  I need a box of metal parts to bend a paper clip to use as a lockpick??  At least the lockpicking is familiar to Skyrim or Fallout 3 players and not the least bit glitchy.  The blueprints and upgrades are pretty standard, but at least it works like it should. It's a shame you can't make zombies fly with your great hammer of thor like you could in Dead Island.-I think there is enough to recommend, just barely.  I wouldn't get addicted to it like I did with Skyrim.  -The missions are good with variety.-I love the night segment since that actually made my ♥♥♥ pucker up.-Why is there no manual saving option?  I understand the "sleep here to save your game", but I've BSOD'd twice and each time it happened I had already completed a few quests, which were not saved.  Why is there no save at the end of a quest???  Sure it could boost authenticity and immersion, but taking out that option just forces us to back track multiple times to make sure our progress was actually saved.  This is a major disappointment for me.  I don't like having to back track for something that should be in the menu. Overall, the story sort of ruined it for me.  There isn't much immersion especially when compared to games like Metro Last Light.  For me, I consider a game a good buy if I at least get 1 hour per dollar of enjoyable game time.  I'm on the second playthrough and I'm already forcing myself to play, trying to find something interesting and unique. Just over 20 hours played.  I'm getting the same feeling I got with Wolfenstein: The New Order, "why did I pay $60 for this?"  I'm someone who prefers context.  Best example I can think of is: sex with a hooker < sex with a lover. Seriously, I felt unfufilled after I beat the game. It's fun otherwise.  5/10

content:

content:
ry 8, 2015
												The Dead Island sequel we've all been waiting for! Techland improved a lot of the mechanics. The parkour addition makes the world accessible vertically and feels great. Good game for completionists looking to get the most bang for their buck.PROS:-Dead Island with parkour-Excellent skill tree progression gives the game a nice RPG feel as you level up-Tons of content for completionists-Looks awesome in motion. Very nice looking overall.-Day/Night cycles. Night time really ups the tension with special infected and higher XP gains.-Sense of verticality is unparalleled. Was never affraid of heights in a game until Dying LightCONS:-Weapon crafting/variety was much better in Dead Island. Seems like Techland went backwards in this regard.-Only one protagonist, even in multiplayer! Dead Island handled multiplayer much better.-The final encounter is single player only! (This is not a spoiler, the game tells you before you approach it.)-No vehiclesNOTE: The game has nvidia-centric features. AMD users should do some research BEFORE buying.So in a nutshell, diehard DI fans should feel right at home. Just don't expect the same refined co-op experience. Also, the game rips off iconic ideas from mainstream games like Far Cry and Assassins Creed. Not a bad thing in my book, but some may consider this a con. Lastly, expect a very cliche and predictable story. Didn't add this as a con since DI games were never going to win an award for original story telling. It's all about the side quests!I enjoyed all 43 hours of my experience and can't wait to dive back in!

content:
ry 7, 2015
About The Game:Dying Light is a game that touches deep down into the inner soul of what makes a Zombie Apocolypse & captures every little inch of it in a very well crafted and spectacular game.Dying Light is what i call a spiritual successor of Dead Island and in many different ways beats the absolutely crap out of it, this is the game Dead Island strived to be but did not live up to the hype it created.Dying Light is developed by Techland the same guys who brought us Dead Island & published by Warner Brothers Interactive.The Story:The story behind is that a viral outbreak has accured on the city of Harran, and you the player (Kyle Krane) have been sent into the thick of it by the GRE a government organization trying to recover a document & kill the leader of a thug group who was once mayor of the city before the outbreak.Kyle is soon jumped by some thugs and after trying to dispatch of these thugs ends up being bitten by a Infected and becoming infected himself, soon after that you're on a battle of your own trying to survive and help keep the survivor group you're haulled up with alive as well as yourself.After many events, you gain a feeling of security and home with the group of survivors you are bunked up with & feel the need to seek revenge after many of them perish to the hands of Rais the traitor and eventually lose focus on your primary mission. Soon after that it becomes apparent that things aren't what they seem with the GRE and this is where the story changes drastically.The plot becomes a bit more sinister as the story goes on. You can read below for a more full story at your own risk.Full Story: (THERE ARE PLOT & STORY SPOILERS)Many of your friends have died up to this point & this creates even more hatred towards Rais, he soon attempts to take your life & in trying to do so you cut off his hand. This sends Rais into a rage and he now does everything in his power to make sure that you suffer, killing off main characters and setting up multiple traps to catch you off guard until the final battle where it's balls to the wall and you have to go back to where it all started & get the research that you worked so hard towards getting and keeping safe.The GRE contacts you several times throughout the story trying to bargain with you into getting the cure for them & offering you a free ride out of Harran if you do.Before you reach Rais for the final "showdown" you have to run a gauntlet of Volatiles & infected from the bottom of the building right to the top, this was a pretty cool idea & meant you had to confront not only danger head on but the risk of falling, before making it to the top you find a lot of Rais's men dead or dying on the lower levels of the structure, PLOT TWIST:Rais made a deal with the GRE and backstabbed the guys he had been protecting in order to ensure a safe escape for himself.The final fight takes place ontop of a crane and was a major let down, at least for me because it all consists of Quick Time Events. Nothing fun or challenging here, i mean i didn't even get to kick him off the god damn crane?! In the end you're pretty much just watching a movie.In the end you kill Rais, claim the cure & tell the GRE to go ♥♥♥♥ themselves.Note:The GRE want the cure to sell off as they plan on releasing the "Harran Virus" to the public and creating a zombie epidemic, outside of Harran making it more like a "controlled epidemic" this way they can make a profit from dirty money. Although this is the end of the story it doesn't end here. There's still much more to do in Harran.The Gameplay:The gameplay that Dying Light sets up is very solid and brings into play everything you should expect in a "Zombie Survival" game.Limited guns and ammo.Lots of running around. Plenty of parkour elements so you can scale buildings and fences to escape the clutches of the zombies.Crafting makes a return from Dead Island.Fluent and very nice Melee combat.RPG Elements to help you progress from a very under developed player into a zombie slaughtering machine.Dynamic day & night cycles. (That drastically alter gameplay & difficulty.)Dynamic weather. (That actually affects gameplay for both you and the enemy.)A full sandbox playground for you to slaughter countless zombies in with no timelimit.Play as the Zombie & invade other players games to slaughter them as they try to survive.Many more things to keep you preoccupied and leave the sensation of never having enough.There's just so much content packed into this game that Dead Island lacked and it's fantastic! I could go on but alas i have limited space to write this review.The Verdict:Dying Light is a HUGE step up from the disappointment that was Dead Island, Techland really stepped up their game with this one and made a fantastic leap in the right direction.I cannot remember the last game except The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim that has entertained me so much to the point where i spend countless hours ingame not bored and not wanting to quit, the usual, just a little bit longer excuse, this game is fantastic and i REALLY applaud Techland for learning from their mistakes and giving us the Zombie Sandbox we've wanted for years!Although this game is a fantastic game at it's core it's also got A LOT of problems that you need to know about before you buy it so please read here:Bad Things:This game is a system hog, (Patch 1.0.4 has fixed this issue but could still be present on older PC's.)Unless you've got a powerful computer don't expect to run this at full settings. My system runs it fine except for a few problems which i will list below.If you do have a powerful system like mine then you're in luck you'll be able to enjoy the game in all it's glory and the wonderful graphics that it has, however.NO MULTI-CORE SUPPORT! (Patch 1.0.4 fixed a lot of the lag issues i recieved, however Multi-Core support still isn't present)What the hell Techland? Are you serious it's 2015, what were you thinking? Inexcusable but at least the game is running smoothly now thanks to 1.0.4 patch.The game has a fair amount of bugs in it and needed time to be ironed out before release. However Techland is releasing fixes for what bugs it has and this is good!Falling out of the map.Zombies spawning inside the map and becoming stuck.AI spotting you through walls & ceilings.These are minor things but are as inexcusable as no multi-core support because all it takes is another week or month to fix these things.The Rating:Finally with all that said and done i come to my rating. This is a tough one & to be honest i am going to have to give this a good 8/10 and here's why.The game itself is as i said the most fun i've had from a Triple A title since Skyrim, however there are a few issues.The falling out of the map or the AI stuck in the map are things i can live with, i cannot live with broken stealth mechanics though, that's frustraiting and should be fixed ASAP as well as the Multi-core support.I still recommend this game but be aware of the few issues that need patching and think wisely before picking this one up if you're still not 100% sure.NOTE: As of Patch 1.0.4 today 15/2/2015 the Frame Skips & video lag has been resolved and as such my score for this game has increased to an 8/10. Thank You Techland!Edit 2: With each patch this game becomes even more recommendable by me. If you see this game drop in price do not hesitate to pick it up! New patches release fairly regularly and offer free content which means, maps, weapons & more!

content:
ry 4, 2015
												After finishing the game, figured I'd give a short review.The game definately has some downfalls, but it can also be very fun at times. If you're looking for a game that has a good story, this is NOT one of them. Pros:- Amazing zombie killing mechanics. Slo-mo head explosions, decapatations, amputations, and thousands of creative ways to murder a zombie.- Creative, different zombie types.- Awesome night time gameplay, truly terrifying.- Great difficulty scaling. Fighting a zombie horde is actually something you may need to avoid, as a situation can turn from a fun zombie killing spree to being eaten alive.- Fantastically fun to play online as a zombie, and even better to play the Co-op campaign.- Weapon crafting is creative, and adds a lot of substance. The ability to modify stats is an added bonus.- Side quests and the open world aspects presented after you have completed the game means you get about a hundred hours of gameplay, depending on how much you like murdering the undead.- Lots to do!Cons:- The game itself isn't optimized very efficiently. Some areas drop your FPS considerably, and in general, using hardware that normally allowed you to play AAA titles on high will only net you a Medium-High. (Tip- Turn down View Distance, it has little impact on gameplay since its mostly Melee). I assume this will be fixed by patches.- Storyline is bland and predictable, the game's attempt at creating an emotional attachment to characters laughably falls through, and you soon find yourself forgetting the names that reappear or are mentioned mid to late game. Most campaign missions put you through mazes, or a generally recycled premises. (Like how many times do you have to be stripped of your weapons? Every single major encounter.)- The parkour mechanics need some work, prepare to fall to your death a few times when your character grabs onto a beam, only to scale and jump over it (Not a good idea on high heights) or even fail to grab a ledge altogether. The grappling hook is pretty.. Interesting too.- The minimap is terrible. Using the indicator to find quest locations. safehouses, etc results in frustration. - There's really no use for money. You can accumulate great amounts, but the weapons sold by the shop tend to be worse than your current- or only 30 minutes away from finding it on a dead guy.In summary :Don't buy the game for it's storyline. It sucks. Other than that, if you just want something to play with your friends then it is a great choice. Or if you just like the good old zombie killing action. Most other issues, like poor optimization and weird parkour mechanics, can be fixed through patches.For what its worth, I'd rate it6.5/10

content:
ry 5, 2015
												To start off, the parkour is very well done.  Less restrictive and glitchy than Assassin's Creed.  -The gameplay is very similar to Dead Island, a little too similar.  You can see shared animations between the two games, which isn't necessarily a bad thing in this case.  -The shooter segments are pretty poorly done to be honest.  There aren't many guns, but they aren't very useful anyway.  Why are there different values and colors for guns that have identical stats and skins??? The animations are just as funky as Dead Island in terms of guns.  If there were suppressors, then maybe it would have a bit more depth.  -PLEASE OPTIMIZE YOUR GAME BEFORE RELEASE!!! I had to knock down the graphics to 720p and everything else on low just to get ~30-40 FPS.  This should not be happening on a GTX 760!! It's not the most powerful card, but it sure can handle a lot more than this game looks.  This is a PC!! 60 FPS is the minimum expectation on low settings with a reasonable rig! This isn't a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ console!! *SPOILER ALERT*- The story is meh at best.  I'm not sure if there was supposed to be a little romance between Crane and Jade.  Some cutscenes are illogical and out of place.  Cut his hand off, but let him live to extend the story?  Insert a far cry 3/4 hallucination level which honestly doesn't make much sense.  I don't think everyone infected traveled through a floating wonder world before they ate someone. It is also SUPER predictable. I was not surprised at any point. I'm not sure if I was supposed to be either.-The voice acting is ok, could use a little more authenticity in their vocals.  Sometimes they don't show much emotion, as if they're reading someone else's script (that's pretty much what they do anyway).  Bioshock infinite is an example of voice acting done right.- Some of the crafting doesn't make much sense.  I need a box of metal parts to bend a paper clip to use as a lockpick??  At least the lockpicking is familiar to Skyrim or Fallout 3 players and not the least bit glitchy.  The blueprints and upgrades are pretty standard, but at least it works like it should. It's a shame you can't make zombies fly with your great hammer of thor like you could in Dead Island.-I think there is enough to recommend, just barely.  I wouldn't get addicted to it like I did with Skyrim.  -The missions are good with variety.-I love the night segment since that actually made my ♥♥♥ pucker up.-Why is there no manual saving option?  I understand the "sleep here to save your game", but I've BSOD'd twice and each time it happened I had already completed a few quests, which were not saved.  Why is there no save at the end of a quest???  Sure it could boost authenticity and immersion, but taking out that option just forces us to back track multiple times to make sure our progress was actually saved.  This is a major disappointment for me.  I don't like having to back track for something that should be in the menu. Overall, the story sort of ruined it for me.  There isn't much immersion especially when compared to games like Metro Last Light.  For me, I consider a game a good buy if I at least get 1 hour per dollar of enjoyable game time.  I'm on the second playthrough and I'm already forcing myself to play, trying to find something interesting and unique. Just over 20 hours played.  I'm getting the same feeling I got with Wolfenstein: The New Order, "why did I pay $60 for this?"  I'm someone who prefers context.  Best example I can think of is: sex with a hooker < sex with a lover. Seriously, I felt unfufilled after I beat the game. It's fun otherwise.  5/10

												Overall this game is very fun, but there are several problems that may question you wanting to buy this game. Here are the Pros & Cons.-Pros:Fun, fluent gameplay with an outstanding parkour systemThere is so much to do throughout the mapI have never wanted to 100% a game so muchThe combat is also fluent and doesn't get very repetitiveThe co-op is very funny and some things you can do are complete jokes-Cons:Trash story that is very shortWhoever wrote this had a book of cliche's right next to him (Bad guy screams your name, leaves you for dead, says your   not a man, and there is a quick-time event at the end)Fetch quests are the new meta?FPS drops here and there-Be The Zombie is broken:   Survivor sense is overpowered and defeats the purpose of hunting survivors when they hunt the Night Hunter   The Night Hunter has to defend even thought he supposedly "hunts"   Connection is so trash, especially in BTZ   Early levels of BTZ are very frustratingCo-op is pretty sloppy when it comes to animations, connection, and style.Poor DLC (So Far)Overall, it is a fun, singleplayer game that has solid gameplay, but everything else is pretty bad. If you make this purchase, keep in mind that it is for the zombie-whacking hardcore-parkour experience, not the story.

content:
7, 2015
												Like expected, it is similar to Dead Island in a lot of ways. So, where does it differ? Well, the graphics and general tone of the game are a lot grittier and darker than Dead Island. Think of this as the Empire Strikes Back to Dead Island's Star Wars. The looting and melee part of the game is very similar. You pick up, trade, craft weapons and use blueprints to upgrade them and so on. They increase in damage as you level up and unlock rarer varieties. The free-running is unique here - I don't think I have ever seen it done in a first person game before. It is both a blessing and a curse. It's a blessing because when it works, it works really well and gives a new depth to the game that would not have existed without it. It's a curse because it can be extremely fiddly and disorientating. Sometimes things just don't seem to work as well as they should and simple things turn into frustration inducing annoyances. It's a real shame too, since the system is *almost* good. Example: want to climb down and hang on the ledge? Forget it, something this simple is possibly the most frustrating thing you will ever do in this game. This game also features a unique night-time experience where you must run, dodge and hide from powerful super-zombies during night time. Unlike the normal Z's, these ones chase you and can run just as fast as you can. When they catch you it's game over - so a race for the nearest safe-zone ensues. This part of the game really fills you with panicked adrenaline and mixes up the pace of the game. It is a welcome and interesting addition. The (side) quests suffer from the same thing they did in Dead Island - fetchy and boring for the most part. There is one exception that I have found so far. In order to tell you about this I will just explain what happened to me: I was tasked by a man in the "tower" to power up 2 electricity generators in town and then head to the main distribution center and power that up. There was a catch - the center is crawling with Z's - I mean, hundreds of the ♥♥♥♥ers - and that's not all, I have to do it AT NIGHT time so that all the Z's get fried when I power it up. First I went and powered up the other 2 sub-stations with little issue. When I reached the main one I think my exact words were something along the lines of "holy ♥♥♥♥ing ♥♥♥♥ ♥♥♥♥". There WERE hundreds of them. I gingerly scouted the area (in the day-time still), to see what I was going to do. There was a small entrance in the fence at the front and no other way in. I also didn't know which of the buildings I had to reach to turn on the generators. I dashed through the fence and jumped onto a van. A horde surrounded me within seconds and I was trapped. Fumbling through my inventory I fashioned 2 molotovs and let rip. The Z's burned and I jumped down. A second massive horde approached and I jumped back onto the van. I spent a few minutes trying to thin the heard, but after a time realised this was not going to work. Low on health, weapons all broken I decided I had to make a break for it. I jumped over several Z heads and ran for an opening, hoping it would lead me somewhere. Z's where everywhere and I was dodging and jumping past them. I came to a fence and vaulted over it. The area was "safe" and had a building. I went in and found the generator I was meant to use - some good luck that this was the right building. Problem was, it was day-time. Fair enough, at least I knew where to come now. I marked the location that I was standing on my map and made my escape. I headed to the nearest safe-zone where I slept until night time... Night was here. It was pitch black. I couldn't see more than 2 metres in front of me without a torch - yet the torch attracted zombies. Great. It's okay, I knew the terrain now and I had a custom waypoint set. All I had to do was get there without anything seeing me. I made my way to the station, slowly, avoiding all the "super-z's". When I got to the station my heart sank - one of the super-z's was pacing along the bit of fence that I had to get through. Bugger. Checking my inventory I found a couple of firecrackers. Hmmmm. I chucked some in the opposite direction and it vaulted over to them, attracting some of the massive horde inside as well. This was it. This was my moment. I ran. Jumping over the van, onto some z-heads. I got stuck on my planned route because there were too many of them. I had to think fast as they were everywhere. At this point I had little choice, I had to turn my torch on to see what was going on. I did. All the Z's turned and began after me. I climbed up a nearby generator before taking a running jump into the enclosure. Running to the building I slammed the door behind me and turned on the generator. I made it, phew. The sound of electric fizzing outside caught my attention and I went for a look. Sure enough, most of the horde was now being fried. One more firecracker left, I chucked it and made my escape. On the way out a super-z noticed me and gave chase. I was clambering up buildings, over fences, through houses to make it to the safe-zone. I picked up about 4 of these super-Z's on the way but finally managed to get the the safe zone. I lit up a cigarette and congratulated myself on a job well done. "You see, preparation is key, bur?", I said to myself.That's a side quest. It has turned out to be my most memorable moment in the game as of yet. When it works, it works really well. This story above however, is not the only way the game works sadly. A lot of time is spent running from point to point doing meaningless fetch quests and trying to climb buildings (and failing) over and over again. It does suffer because of this and the tedious running from point to point doing nothing but boring quests drops my score down from a 8 to a 7. Sure, I can skip this content, but I would miss out on a good chunk of the game as a result.It's a real shame that you begin to become OP later in the game, as the "survival" aspect of the game's early hours where you are scrounging for supplies and having to come up with genius plans to tackle the horde are it's strongest, definitive moments. As the game progresses, this gets thrown out of the window and you are left with another zombie smasher game with free-running tagged on.Jimbo Rating: 7/10

content:
, 2015
												This review is based on my personal opinion.This review will NOT contain spoilers.Every once in a while, I start up my PC feeling wonderful and I wanna play something.This game is always there for me when I feel like I have nothing to play because it's fun to slice zombies up in many different areas multiple times and you'd be proud of yourself because it just feels so rewarding.People who fear scary games should play this though. It remedies your fear. A lot. Because if you want this game but you fear of going outside from safe zones cause there are biters everywhere? Well.. you can't complete anything without fighting them. (Except farm your agility up so high for hours and hours because it takes a long time to do so but agility takes you nowhere because you'd have no fighting skills right?.. right..)But to summarize the gameplay. It has many varities in weapons and I'm not going to mention them here because it's fun to discover them and many of them have their own pros and cons. Regular zombies are like dust on the streets and other types of zombies.. well.. if you're interested... find it out for yourself. They're not hard. Kinda.. *Wink* *Wink*Co-op is excellent and it has even a LAN mode which is quite rare for a game of this time.Newcomers, here's a warning to you: You do NOT want to rush into Be The Zombie mode. It will make you rage quit multiple times. It's a gamemode for tryhards at most but you do NOT need to play this mode to get the full experience of this game. This game DOES have seamless co-op. (Yes you can stay in front of a zombie with your friend and kick the zombie about a 1000 times without having to worry about disconnecting due to inactivity on quests and side quests)On the performance side of things:You will not play this game on max settings. It is impossible. Even with Nvidia settings off it is quite hard to get stable FPS with view distance slider to the fullest extent of its reach because game casts shadows on everything on its screen. (Even the building that haven't been rendered completely? Yes even those and not low quality either. They'll be full HD shadows if you crank your distance to the max)Core i3-3220 would be my personal suggestion of a minimum 1080p smooth experience as I'm running this on 25% View  Distance. Textures, Foliage and Shadows are on the highest quality possible which is High. No Ultra here folks, you'll achieve Ultra with Nvidia Gameworks settings if you enable them. Which you shouldn't cause they cause such a hassle that you'll barely stop stuttering for a few seconds. Yes. Even with an i5. Just not as much as my i3.Basically anyone who has a better rig than mine will run standard 1080p High settings. If you have a monster rig you can go for some of the gameworks settings. I don't recommend it though because 30 FPS isn't acceptable here. 40-60 minimum for a good clean experience in fighting and intense situations.Summarized version: This game has a few bugs. Runs nicely on old systems if you know the capabilities and tinker with the settings right. Story is quite interesting. Has seamless co-op. Nice number of side quests. Spend your time out in the night at your own risk, it's really hard for newcomers and good night, good luck.

content:
ry 26
												This is a fantastic game, so good infact I spent about eight hours a day for three days straight completing the story with a friend. (Excluding The Following) To some I understand that may not seem like a lot, but I have a life alright...Before I list off some pros and cons of the game, let me just say this; This game is fantastic by all means, but I feel it is meant to be played a co op game. As far as I'm concerned, buy it with a buddy or give it a miss. But hey, that's my personal opinion, and I'm an absolute sucker for good co op games.Here is what I love about Dying Light.- Gazi. Gazi is a game changing addition to this game who really helps to define what Dying Light truly is.- Combat is gruesome, satisfying and in some cases quite funny.- Parkour is swift, smooth and feels quite limitless. (You want to climb something, you probably can)- Weapons are unique and ever changing due to durability. You can't stick with one overpowered weapon the whole game.- The skill tree feels somewhat progressive, but more importantly new craftables and abilities are VERY fun.- Charcaters in the game are unique and 'quirky'.- The world is vast and intersting to explore. Quite immersive in my opinion.- The world also offers little missions of sorts aside from the story, such as fighting Rai's men for an air drop or rescuing a survivor from zombies. These missions are rewarding and don't feel repetitive or like a waste of time which is nice.- The enemies in the game are diverse and well made, from slow biters to Rai's men.-The story (despite criticisms of being 'cliche' or 'boring') is atleast decent, and I had fun with it.- The story has side quests which (I'm not sure if this is correct or not) appear to intertwine with the story.- And perhaps one of my favourite things about this game, the fact that no matter how much you progress you will never be safe during the night. It's a constant threat that must be considered, and I LOVE that.Now for a few cons...- Although I didn't play this game singleplayer, I wouldn't consider purchasing it for singleplayer. This game feels as if it's meant to be played co op.- I didn't like the Bozak horde.- The ending isn't that great. Not to say I wasn't atleast 'satisfied' by the ending, it's not fantastic either.- Although it's not major issue, the prologue was rather long, and when I'm itching to jump into a co op session with a friend that can feel like an inconvenience.- The game has a very hefty price tag. It's a great game by all means, and I understand plenty of other games match the price, but I just wish games weren't so expensive nowadays.

												FINAL REVIEW (1-27-15):                                            GOTY so far! Amazing story and fluid gameplay. Highly Recommend!                                             I've been waiting too long for a game like this to come out. I'm hooked.                                            A Game That Lived Up To Its Hype                                                   9/10*Everything below is my "Initial" review* MY SPECS: AMD FX-6300 (No OC)                   R9 270x OC edition 4GbOn all HIGH settings with draw distance turned down a bit (AA and AO still on) I get around 20-40 frames. If you have AMD, Turn off the setting that states "for nVidia". Remember that you can also turn of V-sync to get much better FPS but with more variation. Without V-sync I was getting between 25-100 fps :) While I will admit that this game is not properly optimized at the moment, it is still very much playable. My specs are considered low and I still maintain a game thats more than playable/enjoyable. DON'T FORGET that while this is from the makers of Dead Island, they are now more experienced. I believe DI was Techlands first real game to get its name out there. This game is perdy:) GAMEPLAY: I only just got out into the open world, so I will refrain from saying to much. SO FAR, however, the writing is very well done and graphics/resolution look great (even on medium). Freerunning is simple and fun. Zombies are smart, yet slow like zeds should be. (WILL UPDATE AFTER A FEW HOURS OF PLAY)

content:
7, 2015
												Like expected, it is similar to Dead Island in a lot of ways. So, where does it differ? Well, the graphics and general tone of the game are a lot grittier and darker than Dead Island. Think of this as the Empire Strikes Back to Dead Island's Star Wars. The looting and melee part of the game is very similar. You pick up, trade, craft weapons and use blueprints to upgrade them and so on. They increase in damage as you level up and unlock rarer varieties. The free-running is unique here - I don't think I have ever seen it done in a first person game before. It is both a blessing and a curse. It's a blessing because when it works, it works really well and gives a new depth to the game that would not have existed without it. It's a curse because it can be extremely fiddly and disorientating. Sometimes things just don't seem to work as well as they should and simple things turn into frustration inducing annoyances. It's a real shame too, since the system is *almost* good. Example: want to climb down and hang on the ledge? Forget it, something this simple is possibly the most frustrating thing you will ever do in this game. This game also features a unique night-time experience where you must run, dodge and hide from powerful super-zombies during night time. Unlike the normal Z's, these ones chase you and can run just as fast as you can. When they catch you it's game over - so a race for the nearest safe-zone ensues. This part of the game really fills you with panicked adrenaline and mixes up the pace of the game. It is a welcome and interesting addition. The (side) quests suffer from the same thing they did in Dead Island - fetchy and boring for the most part. There is one exception that I have found so far. In order to tell you about this I will just explain what happened to me: I was tasked by a man in the "tower" to power up 2 electricity generators in town and then head to the main distribution center and power that up. There was a catch - the center is crawling with Z's - I mean, hundreds of the ♥♥♥♥ers - and that's not all, I have to do it AT NIGHT time so that all the Z's get fried when I power it up. First I went and powered up the other 2 sub-stations with little issue. When I reached the main one I think my exact words were something along the lines of "holy ♥♥♥♥ing ♥♥♥♥ ♥♥♥♥". There WERE hundreds of them. I gingerly scouted the area (in the day-time still), to see what I was going to do. There was a small entrance in the fence at the front and no other way in. I also didn't know which of the buildings I had to reach to turn on the generators. I dashed through the fence and jumped onto a van. A horde surrounded me within seconds and I was trapped. Fumbling through my inventory I fashioned 2 molotovs and let rip. The Z's burned and I jumped down. A second massive horde approached and I jumped back onto the van. I spent a few minutes trying to thin the heard, but after a time realised this was not going to work. Low on health, weapons all broken I decided I had to make a break for it. I jumped over several Z heads and ran for an opening, hoping it would lead me somewhere. Z's where everywhere and I was dodging and jumping past them. I came to a fence and vaulted over it. The area was "safe" and had a building. I went in and found the generator I was meant to use - some good luck that this was the right building. Problem was, it was day-time. Fair enough, at least I knew where to come now. I marked the location that I was standing on my map and made my escape. I headed to the nearest safe-zone where I slept until night time... Night was here. It was pitch black. I couldn't see more than 2 metres in front of me without a torch - yet the torch attracted zombies. Great. It's okay, I knew the terrain now and I had a custom waypoint set. All I had to do was get there without anything seeing me. I made my way to the station, slowly, avoiding all the "super-z's". When I got to the station my heart sank - one of the super-z's was pacing along the bit of fence that I had to get through. Bugger. Checking my inventory I found a couple of firecrackers. Hmmmm. I chucked some in the opposite direction and it vaulted over to them, attracting some of the massive horde inside as well. This was it. This was my moment. I ran. Jumping over the van, onto some z-heads. I got stuck on my planned route because there were too many of them. I had to think fast as they were everywhere. At this point I had little choice, I had to turn my torch on to see what was going on. I did. All the Z's turned and began after me. I climbed up a nearby generator before taking a running jump into the enclosure. Running to the building I slammed the door behind me and turned on the generator. I made it, phew. The sound of electric fizzing outside caught my attention and I went for a look. Sure enough, most of the horde was now being fried. One more firecracker left, I chucked it and made my escape. On the way out a super-z noticed me and gave chase. I was clambering up buildings, over fences, through houses to make it to the safe-zone. I picked up about 4 of these super-Z's on the way but finally managed to get the the safe zone. I lit up a cigarette and congratulated myself on a job well done. "You see, preparation is key, bur?", I said to myself.That's a side quest. It has turned out to be my most memorable moment in the game as of yet. When it works, it works really well. This story above however, is not the only way the game works sadly. A lot of time is spent running from point to point doing meaningless fetch quests and trying to climb buildings (and failing) over and over again. It does suffer because of this and the tedious running from point to point doing nothing but boring quests drops my score down from a 8 to a 7. Sure, I can skip this content, but I would miss out on a good chunk of the game as a result.It's a real shame that you begin to become OP later in the game, as the "survival" aspect of the game's early hours where you are scrounging for supplies and having to come up with genius plans to tackle the horde are it's strongest, definitive moments. As the game progresses, this gets thrown out of the window and you are left with another zombie smasher game with free-running tagged on.Jimbo Rating: 7/10

												Let me start by saying so worth the 59.99$ if this is on sale BUY IT! i insist this game gave me a solid 31.1 hours of gameplay so far i idled a little (LEFT somewhere and forgot to shutdown so shave off a good 3 hours of the 31.1) this game has so little cons and so many pros for instance =zombies are amazing looking and have very good blood effects and also limb separation=world looks beautiful and or stunning =parkour is really cool you can run up tons of ledges/jump almost anything=NPCS (characters) were unique & cool (But Sadly were really weak and died shortly after saving them)And thats not even all of it some tiny cons i noticed (Could just be me) sometimes after cutting a limp it rolls around right side up Be The Zombie (A GameMode) i found wasn't the greatest (Played as zombie twice and got attacked and killed twice didnt like both but thats just me nor did i like being the group that attacks the zombie)OverAll i would give this game a nine out of ten (9/10) great work (Rough Write up will be Rewrote later)

												Gra genialna, jedna z najlepszych w jaką mogłem zagrać. Bardzo dobra grafika, ciekawa fabuła choć ogólny zarys bardzo schematyczny, super się gra; bardzo grywalna. Polski dubbing wbrew pozorom nie jest tak zły. Jedyne minusy: trochę droga(jak na rok od premiery), wymaga dobrego sprzętu, mimo wszystko dubbing zbyt obsadzony nastoletnimi głosami, jak ktoś jest wrażliwy to fabuła go doprowadzi do wewnętrznego płaczu xD Świetne mechanizmy i animacje parkouru, odczucią są dosyć zbliżone do tego w prawdziwym życiu.Edit: Niestety dodatek, mimo że ma nowe bronie, a przede wszystkim samochody, psuje prakour (nie ma go praktycznie wcale), a fabuła jest zrobiona "na odwal się", bardzo nieścisła. Jest przynajmniej wreszcie jakiś wybór, czego brakowało w podstawce, ale jest on średniawy.Podsumowanie: Jedna z najlepszysch survivalowych gier, najlepsza jeśli chodzi o "brutalną kreatywność". Najlepszy "symulator parkouru" i jedna z najlepszych gier o zombie.Serdecznie polecam.Ocena:9,5/10

content:
7, 2015
												Overall this game is very fun, but there are several problems that may question you wanting to buy this game. Here are the Pros & Cons.-Pros:Fun, fluent gameplay with an outstanding parkour systemThere is so much to do throughout the mapI have never wanted to 100% a game so muchThe combat is also fluent and doesn't get very repetitiveThe co-op is very funny and some things you can do are complete jokes-Cons:Trash story that is very shortWhoever wrote this had a book of cliche's right next to him (Bad guy screams your name, leaves you for dead, says your   not a man, and there is a quick-time event at the end)Fetch quests are the new meta?FPS drops here and there-Be The Zombie is broken:   Survivor sense is overpowered and defeats the purpose of hunting survivors when they hunt the Night Hunter   The Night Hunter has to defend even thought he supposedly "hunts"   Connection is so trash, especially in BTZ   Early levels of BTZ are very frustratingCo-op is pretty sloppy when it comes to animations, connection, and style.Poor DLC (So Far)Overall, it is a fun, singleplayer game that has solid gameplay, but everything else is pretty bad. If you make this purchase, keep in mind that it is for the zombie-whacking hardcore-parkour experience, not the story.
